description: ATLANTA, June 3  A shakeup of the New York Mets pitching staff, which has been injured and battered all season, appeared imminent tonight as the team ended its series with the Atlanta Braves.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: A band of rain and thunder clouds extends from New England through the Middle and South Atlantic States to the Tennessee Valley and the Gulf Coast States. Rain clouds are also apparent over the upper Mississippi Valley. Broken cloudiness is scattered over western Texas and clear skies cover the rest of the country.

title: Dance: African Festival
description: THE Brooklyn Academy of Music may never be the same now that DanceAfrica 79 has blazed through its portals. Certainly its resident music and dance programs may look a little sedate after the throbbing drums, rich costuming and ritual workouts of this AfricanAmerican dance festival, which opened at the academy on Saturday and will be seen again next Saturday night and Sunday afternoon.

title: Trying It
description: Those who wish to try canepole angling in the Northeast will do well with pan fish on many warmwater streams, lakes and ponds.

title: Reagan and Kennedy in the LeadIn California Poll on 80 Favorites
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 3There ws bad news for President Carter in last week's California Poll reports. Nor was the news all that good for Gov. Edmund G. Brown Jr.

title: Commodities
description: WHAT is gold bullion worth? Assuming the metal was 999.5 percent pure, its cash price late last Friday was $275.35 an ounce in New York, the leading gold market. A year ago, the cash price was about $190 an ounce.

title: Dollar Stronger Against the Yen
description: TOKYO, Monday, June 4 (AP) The dollar opened at 221.50 yen on the Tokyo foreign exchange market this morning. It had closed Friday at 221.40 yen.

title: Holdout Juror in Flood's Mistrial Is Said to Fail 2 Polygraph Tests
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  The lone holdout for acquittal in the bribery and conspiracy mistrial of Representative Daniel J. Flood last February has failed two polygraph tests in which Federal agents asked him questions about jury tampering in the case, Justice Department sources said.

title: Kathy E. Kleinbard Married to Lawyer
description: Kathy Ellen Kleinbard, administrator of the Rockefeller University Hospital, was married yesterday to Kris Heinzelman, an associate with the New York law firm of Cravath, Swaine & Moore. Justice Samuel J. Silverman of the State Supreme Court's Appellate Division performed the ceremony at Harkness House.

title: New York Sets June 12 For Midtown Car Plan
description: June 12 will be the starting date for New York City's ban on private passenger cars from 49th and 50th Streets between Third and Seventh Avenues. They will be prohibited for five hours on weekdays.

title: WagePriceGuides toGet Review
description: WASHINGTON, June 3, (Reuters) Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said today that President Carter's current wage and price guidelines needed revising and updating.

title: $1.2 Million in Flemish Paintings Stolen From Convent Near Rome
description: ROME, June 3 (UPI)  Thieves broke into a Roman Catholic converft tod, and stole eight Flemish paintings worth me $1.2 million, including one by Rubens, the police said.

title: Shutting Hospitals, Gaining Health
description: The budget crunch  and common sense  dictate that New York City must close some municipal hospitals. Hospital unions have resisted. So have interns and residents, affected neighborhoods and minority groups representing patients and workers. Yet all of them know that the fiscal surgery is needed.

title: Behind Stained Glass: a Computer
description: TROY, N.Y.  A former Roman Catholic chapel here on the campus.of the Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute is being converted into a $7 million computer center, but its Gothic arches. granite walls and stainedglass windows are being preserved in the belief that traditional values are a part of modern society and important in the education of tomorrow's engineers.

title: Notes on People
description: At one point in the movie Manhattan, the 42yearold writer played by Woody Allen meets his 17yearold lover, played by Martel Hemingway, outside her school. It is clearly identified as the Dalton School on East 89th Street, and the onscreen association has upset some people at Dalton, including Lee Guber, the theatrical producer, whose 11yearold daughter attends the school.

title: Body of Amin Victim Is Flown Back to Israel

title: 21 Roadeo Bus Drivers Ride In Showdown at Shea Corral

title: South Korean Keeps World Boxing Title
description: SEOUL, South Korea, June 3 (UPI)The World Boxing Council superlightweight champion, Kim Sanghyun of South Korea, retained his title today with a unanimous 15round decision over Fitzeroy Giussipi of Trinidad and Tobaeo.

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: As Anwar Sadat comes under increasing pressure from the rest of the Arab world, the country that ought to have the most urgent concern about his survival is Israel. Logically, the Israeli Government should be Mina what it can to bolster Sadat's credibility. It should be acting with a restraint designed to ease Arab fears of the IsraeliEgyptian peace treaty.

description: A Secret Service agent who witnessed hitandrun accident Saturday night and then gave chase was credited yesterday with the arrest in connection with the incident.

Led by Citicorp Credit Inc., the Americans are offering convenient, cheap consumer credit to middleclass Japanese. The credit is of the kind that has long been familiar in the United States.

title: Amish  Face Polio Outbreak With Faith in God Rather Than Vaccine

(Romans 12:2.)

description: HARTFORD, June 3 (AP)  The state's Health Department says tests of water supplies in several towns that had shown significant amounts of asbestos fiber two years ago now showed no trace of the material.

description: Diane Gail Lipton, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Harvey L. Lipton of East Rockaway, L.I., was married there yesterday to Monte Jonathan Gollub, son of Mr. and Mrs. Harold Gollub of Brooklyn. Rabbi Stanley Platek performed the ceremony at the HewlettEast Rockaway Jewish Center.

title: Ickx, in Lola, Takes CanAm Race Easily
description: BOWMANVILLE, Ontario, June 3 (UPI)  Jacky Ickx drove his Citicorp 550horsepower Lola to an easy victory today in the $75,000 Mosport CanAm race. The triumph gave the 34yearold Belgian a firm grip on the lead in the CanAm standing.

description: PALO ALTO, Calif.  Raymond T. Burkeley lived in the same Sunnyvale, Calif., neighborhood as Ken Oshman when ROLM was just getting started.

title: The OPEC Tiger in Our Tank
description: It now looks as if OPEC's official price will be raised by another 15 percent this month, or even more if the oilhungry nations do not mind their consumption in the next few weeks. Predictably, the increase will be a compromise after the usual bickering among OPEC hawks and doves. The only thing more certain is that there will be other increases after that, and after that, until the industrial nations finally make a determined affort to reduce their dependence on oil imports.

title: Luigi Piccolo's Football Days
description: IN the football game Lou Little loved to tell about, he played tackle for a Pennsylvania team that lost Dartmouth, 2019, in the Polo Grounds in New York 1919. Like Lou, who bad been a captain of infantry World War I, the top players on both sides were several years older and many degrees tougher than the average undergraduate.

title: Correspondent's Daughter, 15, Dies of an Apparent Heart Attach
description: LEESBURG, Va., June 3 (UPI)  Amy Louise Sloyan, a 15yearold daughter of Newsday's White House correspondent, Patrick J. Sloyan, died today of an apparent heart attack at Loudoun Memorial Hospital. She was taken to the hospital after collapsing at her Virginia home.

title: Canadian Press Discute Settled
description: VICTORIA, British Columbia, June (AP)  A tentative agreement was reached yesterday between Victoria Press, publisher of two newspapers, The Colonist and The Times, and its five unions. Details of the agreement, reached after a 24hour bargaining session, were not announced.

title: Whites Wait to See How Muzorewa Government Works
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, June 3  Walter Purcell donned his tweeds today and headed for the Salisbury polo grounds, little different in mood or manner than he was when he resigned his officer's commission with the Gurkhas in India and settled in Rhodesia as a brewery executive 28 years ago.

title: A bbijane, at 21, Designing a Future
description: How do you get to be a famous fashion designer?

title: Bunker Ramo Rejects Offer
description: The board of directors of the Bunker Ramo Corporation has rejected a proposal under which it would eventually be merged into Fairchild Industries, a Bunker Ramo spokesman said yesterday.

title: F.A.A. Reports Disturbing Faults In 2 DC10's and Asks New Checks
description: The Federal Aviation Administration yesterday told operators of DC10 jets that particularly disturbing flaws had been found in aft attachment poInts of underwing engine mounts of two planes in inspections ordered after the crash of an American Airlines jetliner in Chicago May 25.

title: Jim Hutton, Actor, 45; Was TV Ellery Queen
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3 (UPI)  Jim Hutton, who played the detective Ellery Queen in the NBCTV series in 1975 and 1976, died yesterday at Los Angeles New Hospital of liver cancer. He was 45 years old.

title: Weekly Lotto Numbers Drawn
description: The number's picked Saturday night in New York State's weekly Lotto drawing were 25, 22, 2, 13, 35 and 20. The supplementary number was 37.

title: Ban on Cigar and Pipe Smoking Found on 9 of 14 Airlines Polled
description: LOS ANGELES, June 3 (AP)  It began when a stewardess told Elizabeth Bailey that the nosmoking section was filled and offered her a seat in the smoking section.

title: Top Ville Triumphs In $430,000 Race
description: PARIS, June 3  Yves St. Martin rode favored Top Ville to victory in track record time of 2:25 in the $430,000 Prix du Jockey Club classic for 3yearolds at Chantilly racetrack today.

title: Papal Pilgrimages: Pope as a JetAge Missionary Breaks With Centuries of Tradition
description: From the time the Holy See moved back to Rome from Avignon in the 15th century until the coronation of Pope Paul VI; Roman Catholic pontiffs have been disinclined to travel.

title: Music: Imre Patio Conducts Naumburg Concert
description: DESPITE the benevolent weather  slightly overcast but with no serious threat of rain  the turnout for the first free openair Naumburg concert of the summer on Central Park's Mall on Saturday afternoon seemed somewhat more sparse than in past years. About threequarters of the benches before the bandshell were filled, a respectable crowd, but nothing like the standingroomonly conditions that have often prevailed at this 74yearold New York institution.

title: A THIRD OF ITALIANS VIEW TV HOLOCAUST
description: ROME, June 3  The first two installments of Holocaust, the American dramatization of the Nazi slaughter of the Jews, shown on Italian. television on successive Sunday nights, have inspired big newspaper headlines and partisan comment from political candidates but seem to have been taken in stride by many Italians.

title: 20 Million More In School Funds Pledged by Koch
description: The Koch administration privately promised at least $20 million more for New York City schools as leaders of the city government gathered at Gracie Mansion last night to decide on the mix of services that the city would provide next year.

title: Redemption Of Mite Stock
description: The Mite Corporation announced that it had proposed to redeem on July 13 all of the company's series A convertible preferred stock that was issued in 1969.

title: Major Drop In Rental Units Cited
description: A shrinkage in the nation's inventory of rental apartments has begun to impede the ability of Americans to choose between renting and buying to meet their housing needs, a choice that many have long taken for granted.

description: Soccer on a Table Top

title: A JudicialDistrict Split Promotes Political Unity
description: Some strange bedfellows are promoting a newly introduced bill in Albany that would divide the State Supreme Court judicial district for Manhattan and the Bronx into two districts, one for each borough. Bronx and Manhattan

title: Mauritanian President Resigns 11 Months After Coup
description: NOUAKCHOTT, Mauritania, June 3 (Agence FrancePresse)  President Mustapha Ould Salek of Mauritania resigned today, according to a Government announcement, and was replaced by Lieut. Col. Mohammed Mahmoud Ould Luiv.

title: Nancy Lopez Captures 3d Event in low
description: NEW ROCHELLE, N.Y., June 3 Nancy Lopez won her third straight golf tournament today and earned the $15,000 first prize in the $100,000 Golden Lights tourney at Wykagyl Country Club for the second year in a row.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY

title: California, Wary on Birth Flaws,, May Order Wide Drug Warning
description: BERKELEY, Calif., June 3  California is considering a labeling order that would require the makers of overthecounter drugs to warn pregnant and nursing mothers to consult a doctor before using the products because their effects on fetuses and infants are largely unknown

title: Quebec Party Agrees to Put a Plan for Limited Independence to Vote
description: QUEBEC, June 3  Quebec's ruling Parti Qubcois ended a threeday convention today after agreeing to submit to the province's voters a proposal to create a sovereign Quebec whose independence would be limited by a tight economic association with the rest of Canada.

title: Rock: A New Tom Robinson Arrives
description: TOM ROBINSON emerged last year as one of the most interesting exponents of the new rockandroll coming out of Britain. Like Elvis Costello, Graham Parker, Ian Dury and others, he combined the fervor and intensity of newwave rock with real craftsmanship and intelligence in his songwriting. And more than any of them, he was explicitly political, shaping his songs and his, image around a whole multitude of radicalleft causes.

title: Iran Governor Accuses  A Palestinian Leader
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 3 (UPI) The Governor General of the oilproducing province of Khuzistan charged today that George Habash, leader of the Popular Front for the Liberation of Palestine, was involved in suspicious activities in the province, where ethnic Arabs are demanding autonomy.

title: British Airways Names Chief
description: Roy Watts, 53 years old; has been named chief executive of British Airways, the international airline. He succeeds Ross Stainton, 65, who becomes chairman of the board. Kenneth Wilkenson, 62, was appointed deputy chairman.

title: Carter at Church Service Gives Randolph Tribute
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (AP)  President .Carter, at one point apparently moved to tears, today honored the memory of the late civil rights leader, A. Philip Randolph.

title: The Dance: Debuts in Quixote
description: IT was just a year ago that Mikhail Baryshnikov's version of the 19thcentury Russian comedy ballet classic Don Quixote had its premiere with American Ballet Theater. And within its short life span, that first American production seemed already to be falling apart in New York last autumn.

title: Rena Koopman, A Goldsmith, Bride Of Lewis Smith 3d
description: RenaBeatrice Koopman and Lewis Conrad Smith 3d were married yesterday at the home of Mr. and Mrs. Richard Koopman, parents of the bride, in West Hartford, Conn. Rabbi Neil

title: Olive Templeton, 96; A Broadway Actress
description: Olive Templeton, a Broadway actress, died last Tuesday in her Manhattan apartment. She was 96 years old.

title: U.S. Fails to Qualify For Olympic Soccer
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., June 3  The United States will not be represented in soccer at the Olympic Games in Moscow next year.

title: World News Briefs
description: ORABA, Uganda, June 3 (AP)  Tanzanian and Ugandan Government soldiers captured former President Idi Amin's home village of Koboko during the weekend and pushed north to the Sudanese border, consolidating their control over the country. A commanding officer informally declared the sevenmonth war at an end.

title: The State of ChurchState Relations in Poland
description: WARSAW  A thousand foreign journalists who came to Warsaw with the Pope hurriedly studied the history of Poland. They were particularly interested in a conflict that flared up 900 years ago between Bishop Stanislaus and the King, who killed him and went down in history as Boleslaw the Bold. There was no reason, however, to refer to this most tragic episode between the church and the state in their 1,000yearold relationship.

title: Disabled Jackson Broadcasts Game
description: Reggie Jackson went on the 15day disabled list yesterday, but got another job right away  as televison and radio broadcaster. Jackson worked five innings as a commentator for the YankeeWhite Sox game on local radio (WINS) and spent the final six innings in the television booth for WPIX (Channel 11). The Yankees won, 32, in the 11th.

title: Tom Seaver Is 2 and 4
description: IN other years Tom Seaver always had it easy. When in doubt he simply threw his fastball. Fired it. Hummed it. Turned on the heat. And his fastball moved. It sailed up and in to a righthanded batter. Jammed him, the pitchers say. It sailed up and away from a lefthanded bat ter. Had him reaching, the pitchers say. For those batters quick enough to get around on his fastball, they usually popped it up or squibbed a grounder. Often they never touched it. Some might foul off a couple, but sooner or later they swung and missed and slouched back to the dugout. Another strikeout, another K in the score books. Another line in the record book.

title: NewLawHasnt  Set Off Mass Loss of U.S. Aides
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  The feared exodus of top Federal officials because of new conflict-of-interest legislation, which takes effect July 1, has proved less brain drain than a trickle.

title: 200th English Derby Is Like a Fairy Tale
description: ONCE upon a time, in an island kingdom, there lived a queen who had all her heart desired, except that she had never owned the winner of the most important horse race in her realm Year arter year the queen watched her entries finish never better than second, often far worse. Her people were saddened, because the race was not only the most important In the realm but also the most popular. Then, one year, for the 200th running of the race, the Queen finally seemed to have a winner.

title: Thirteen Hurt at Kennedy Airport Exiting DC10 After Bomb Threat
description: Thirteen persons suffered minor injuries on the emergencyexit chutes of an American Airlines DC10 jet yesterday after the San Franciscobound plane returned to Kennedy International Airport following a report of a bomb on board, the Port Authority notice said.

title: CanePoling For Pan Fish
description: WHITE LAKE, N.C. JOEL ARRINGTON of Raleigh, N.C., and I had at first planned to flyfish his state's lovely mountain streams for trout. But various circumstances intervened, and so we turned away from the hills and drove south to the coastal plain, where we would meet. Rudolph and Helen Inman at their hostelry at White Lake. Our new goal: canepole angling for pan fish.

title: Marriage Announcement 1 -- No Title
description: Michael Delfiner Weds Tracey Tisdall at Smith

title: Pope's Visit Adds to Fervor of Young Poles
description: WARSAW, June 3  Andrzej, a 19yearold highschool student, stood among the throngs of young people who turned out today for an early morning mass for youth, the last official function presided over by Pope John Paul II before leaving this city.

title: Virginia Loeb Bride Of James Sperling
description: The marriage of Virginia Alison Loeb, a candidate for a master's degree in art history at Brown University, to James Douglas Sperling, who graduated last month from the Northeastern University Law School, took place yesterday in Brookfield Center, Conn. Rabbi Henry Shreibman performed the ceremony at the home of the bride's parents, Mr. and Mrs. John H. Loeb of New York and Brookfield Center. The bridegroom is the son of Donald A. Sperling of New York and the late Mrs. Sperling.

title: Deaths
description: MUNKFanny. Fitth Avenue Synagogue records with deep sorrow the death of the mother of Mrs. Immanoel Jakobovits (Amelie). To the entire family, we express our heartfelt sympathy.

title: Why So Many Triple Crown Winners?
description: YEAR after year, the myth took shape: Thoroughbred racing had become so competitive that there might never be another Triple Crown winner.

title: Palestinian Group Warns of Future Assassinations
description: BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 3  Palestinian guerrilla leaders warned here today that the assassination on Friday of prominent supporter of Egypt's peace treaty with Israel would not be the last.

title: Episcopal Panel Advises Church Not to Bar Homosexual Priests
description: A national Episcopal Church commission recommended yesterday that homosexuals be allowed to be ordained as priests if able and willing to conform their behavior to that which the church affirms as wholesome.

title: Udall Said to Turn Down Request By Carter for 1980 Endorsement
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)  President Carter asked Representative Morris K.. Udall to endorse him for reelection, but the Arizona Democrat turned him down, The Washington Star reported today.

title: Bus Terminal's Renewal Is Year Behind Schedule
description: The tens of thousands of rushhour commuters who use the Port Authority's midtown bus terminal are in for at least one more summer of cramped, hot, and smoky bus platforms before the first part of a $160 million expansion of the terminal can be finished.

title: Pintor Upsets Zarate
description: LAS VEGAS, Nev., June 3 (AP)  A surprised Lupe Pintor of Mexico City took the World Boxing Council bantamweight championship from Carlos Zarate today with a split decision that caused a gasp at Caesars Palace when it was announced.

title: Obituary 5 -- No Title
description: Memorial Beroires

title: Shoreham Action Is One of Largest Held Worldwide
description: SHOREHAM, L.I., June 3  More than 600 protesters were arrested here today after 15,000 demonstrators gathered on the town beach to protest the construction of a nuclearpower generating plant by the Long Island Lighting Company.

title: Manila Meeting Ends With Progress on Help For Poorest Countries
description: MANILA, June 3  The world's rich and poor.nations ended a trade and development conference here today with pledges of larger aid programs for the world's most backward countries, agreement to fight mounting barriers to international trade and approval of ways to stabilize prices of raw materials.

title: Sports World Specials
description: They're not people who put things off until the last minute, and so Tony Lenzini and Dan Roberts have left for the 1980 Olympic Games in Moscow.

title: Ballet: Russian Cockney
description: ATURDAY was a giddy day at the New York State Theater. Outside, children held a jumprope contest. Inside, Mikhail Baryshnikov impersonated a Cockney musichall entertainer at the New York City Ballet's afternoon performance.

title: White Ends Merger Talks
description: CLEVELAND, June 3  The White Motor Corporation announced today that it hqd terminated merger talks with a West German truck maker.

title: PoliceSearch Ban in Newsrooms Would Be Harmful, Panel Is Told
description: WASHINGTON, June 3 (UPI)  The current healthy and productive relationship between the nation's press and prosecutors would be marred by legislation barring police searches of newsrooms, the National District Attorneys Association has told Congress.

title: Oman Wary of Soviet Buildup in Southern Yemen
description: SARFAIT, Oman, May 29  From a cliff 9,000 feet above the Arabian Sea, the territory of Southern Yemen was discernible.

title: TV SPORT
description: TODAY

title: U.S. Oil Outlook Called Fragile; Further Spot Shortages Foreseen
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  The nation's oil outlook for the next year calls at best for an extremely fragile balance between supply and demand and for spot shortages and rising prices to continue, according to energy officials in the Carter Administration and private oil analysts.

title: Trenton Times Adds an Edition
description: TRENTON, June 3 (AP)  The Trenton Times's new morning edition is scheduled to make its debut tomorrow. Donald E. Lippincott, the newspaper's managing editor for the last 10 years, has been promoted to deputy editor, with overall supervisory responsibilities for both the morning and afternoon editions. He will also be in charge of newsroom operations and editorial decisions in the absence of the editor, Robert Bentley.

title: Study Finds Major In U.S. Cities Financial Reports
description: DETROIT, June 3  A study of the annual financial reports of 100 cities across the nation has found substantial inade quacies in the reports. The study, conducted by a major Accounting firm, concluded that most of the reports that were examined failed to provide the complete or clear statement of a city's health needed by investors, taxpayers and even gervernment officials.

title: Carey May Veto Year's Extension For Heart Law
description: Governor Carey said yesterday that he was prepared to veto a oneyear extension of the heart law, which enables police officers and firemen who develop heart ailments on or off the job to retire on threequarter pensions.

title: News Summary
description: Solidarity with Sovietbloc Christians was pledged in Gniezno, Poland, by Pope John Paul II, who called the people of Eastern Europe the often forgotten Christians. The Pope also stressed the importance of church education for the young and praised Polish youth for its perseverence in its faith. [Page A1, Column 6.]

title: The Editorial Notebook
description: Jones Beach State Park has opened for its 50th season, still giving New Yorkers magnificent ocean and bay beaches, impeccably designed, immaculately kept. The anniversary must bring to mind Robert Moses, who saw the potential in a halfsubmerged sand spit, wrested control of it from its neighbors and found the talents and money to design the park and its access network. Mr. Moses, then 40 years old, made his public debut on the Jones Beach boardwalk.

title: ISRAEL WILL PERMIT MILITANTS TO SETTLE BY A WEST BANK CITY
description: JERUSALEM, June 3  The Israeli Cabinet voted today to permit a militant Jewish group to settle in a sensitive area in the West Bank and authorized the seizure of Arabowned land for the purpose

title: Fans Are Puzzled, Angry
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., June  Many fans of the Cosmos at Giants Stadium reacted with surprise, puzzlement and some anger today to the dismissal Friday of Eddie Firmani. the coach who had led the team to the North American Soccer League championship the last two seasons.

title: Eroding Loyalty Weakens House Leaders
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  A proposal for public financing of Congressional elections was coming up for a vote in House committee last week, and Speaker Thomas P. O'Neill Jr. was lobbving hard for the bill. One key vote was Representative Joseph G. Minish, an organization Democrat from Newark, and the Speaker was pressing him.

title: Joanne Gutter Is Wed to M.H. Notowidigdo
description: At Temple Israel in Columbus, Ohio, yesterday, Joanne Susan Gutter, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Marvin L. Gutter of Bexley Ohio was married to M. Hartoko Notowidigdo, corporate director of information systems with Borden Inc. in Columbus. He is the son of Moekarto Notowidigdo, former Indonesian Ambassador to the United States, India and Canada, and Mrs. Notowidigdo of Jakarka. Rabbi Harvey S. Goldman performed the ceremony.

title: Dividend Meetings
description: Partiel list of scheduled meetings for week follows:

title: Gas Additive Rules Expected to Ease
description: WASHINGTON, June 3  The White House is expected to announce the relaxation of two environmental regulations tomorrow as a means of expanding tight gasoline supplies.

title: Communist Losses Are Predicted as Italians Vote in a TwoDay Election
description: ROME, June 3  Italians began voting today in a twoday election for Parliament amid predictions that the governing Christian Democrats will consolidate their position as the country's leading party and that the Communists will lose some seats for the first time since World War II.

title: Plant Outlays Expected to Rise in 79
description: Spending for new plant and equipment is expected to increase substantially nationwide in 1979, the Conference Board said in its quarterly report released over the weekend.

title: The Lament Of Rich Lossage
description: WHEN Rich Gossage reacted to a shove from Cliff Johnson in the bathroom of the Yankee clubhouse at the Stadium, he had no way of knowing that his own shove would knock him all the way to an enforced vacation in Wyckoff, N.J., Dick Tidrow to Chicago and Paul Mirabella to Columbus, Ohio. But it did, and that makes his injury all the

title: Issue and Debate
description: ALBANY, June 3  A couple buy a new house. They manage to get a bank loan. They go to buy fire insurance and suddenly the dream begins to unravel. Because they live in a certain ZIP code area, they discover they cannot buy fire insurance.

title: Rock: Supertramp Fills Garden
description: THERE is a genre of rock bands that probably comes closer to defining late 70's popular music for white American young people than disco, soft rock or any of the other competing styles. That genre consists of an overtly poporiented; tuneful, technologically sophisticated, rhythmically vital yet always smooth eclectism, descended from the Beatles late progressive songs. and the whole school of late 60'searly 70's British progressive rock. The principal purveyors of the sound today include Emerson, Lake and Palmer, Yes, Genesis, Styx, Boston, Queen and, paramount at the moment, Supertramp, which sold out Madison Square Garden on Thursday night.

title: Cosmos Win, 31, Under New Coach
description: EAST RUTHERFORD, N.J., June  The Cosmos made Ray Klivecka's coaching debut today a success.

title: Marriage Announcement 3 -- No Title
description: Elizabeth Wofsey Married

title: Murderer Earns a CrirninaJJustice Degree
description: NEWARK, June 3  Along with 800 other Rutgers University students here, Samuel Bynes Jr. received a master's degree today. Mr. Bynes, however, was the only student whose home during his college years was the maximumsecurity section of Trenton State Prison.

title: Judith Lynn Fox Is Married to Bernard Christian Javelly
description: Judith Lynn Fox, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Robert Jay Fox of New York and Westhampton Beach, L.I., was married yesterday at the Park Avenue Christian Church to Bernard Christian Javelly, son of Mrs. Pierre Javelly of Mexico City and the late Mr. Javelly. Rabbi Roy Rosenberg and the Rev. Thomas A. Modungo of St. Patrick's Cathedral performed the ceremony.

title: Jazz: 2 Concerts Hail Minusas Composer
description: THE purpose of two concerts of Mingus Music held at Carnegie Hall on Friday and Saturday evenings was, according to one of the producers, to serve as a reminder that, in addition to being a vir tuoso bassist and an influential band leader, Charles Mingus, who died last January, was a major jazz composer whose music should continue to be heard.

title: IRAN, IN SNIFF, BARS ENVOY U.S SELECTED
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Iran has rescinded its agreement to receive Walter. L. Cutler as the new American Ambassador and has demanded that the United States name another envoy. But the state Department said today that the request had been rejected and Mr. Cutler's name would not be withdrawn.

title: SteelQuota Extension Expected
description: WASHINGTON, June 9  The White House, under intense domestic industry pressure, is expected to announce this week an extension of restraints Initiated in 1976 on imports of specialty steel, Administration officials reported today.

title: Events
description: ROD STEWART, rock performer, Madison Square Garden, 8.

title: ABOUT EDUCATION
description: WHEN the Wilson College Alumnae Association marks its 100th anniversary this weekend, it will also celebrate an unprecedented event in American higher education  the resurrection of a college proclaimed dead less than four months ago by its own trustees. The saving of the small 110yearold liberal arts college for women in Chambersburg, Pa., was accomplished by an extraordinary show of loyalty by hundreds of alumnae and by a local judge who performed an unusually thorough autopsy on the alleged corpse only to rescind its death.

title: Uniroyal Talks Resume Today
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 4 (UPI)  Representatives of the United Rubber Workers and Uniroyal Inc. will resume contract talks tomorrow for the first time since a Federal judge ruled illegal President Carter's use of sanctions against companies that do not comply with his wageprice guidelines. The guidelines had been me major issue in stalled negotiations between the union and the nation's third largest tire maker. The union struck Uniroyal nearly a month ago.

title: Baylor Player of Month
description: Don Baylor, who batted .354 for the California Angels in May, was named yesterday the American League player of the month. Jim Kern of the Texas Rangers was named pitcher of the month.

title: Tonka Sues Mego On Stock Purchase
description: SPRING PARK, Minn., June 4 (Reuters)  The Tonka Corporation filed suit today to force Mego International Inc. to divest itself of the Tonka stock it owns.

title: Philip V. H. Weems, 91; Aided Lindbergh, Byrd
description: ANNAPOLIS, Md., June 4 (AP) Capt. Philip Van Horn Weems, a pioneer in sea and air navigation who worked with Charles A. Lindbergh and Richard E. Byrd, died yesterday at Anne Arundel General Hospital after a short illness. He was 91 years old.

title: Texans Packing Extra Gas Tanks In a New Age of Fuel Shortages
description: DALLAS, June 4  At a time when motorists in parts of the country are feeling the effects of tight gasoline supplies, some Texans are having extra fuel tanks fitted on their pickup trucks and recreational vehicles.

title: ExGov. Faubus Said to Use State Police for Spying
description: LITTLE ROCK, Ark., June 4 (UPI) Papers kept by former Gov. Orval E. Faubus indicate that after the Little Rock school integration crisis of 1957, the state police served as a political arm for the Governor's office, conducting surveillance and investigations of political foes, blacks and leftwingers.

title: BOTH MAJOR PARTIES LOSE SOME STRENGTH IN ITALIAN ELECTION Communists Slip, as Expected, but So Do Christian Democrats  Smaller Groups Gain
description: ROME, Tuesday, June 5  Italy's two leading parties, the Christian Democrats and the Communists, lost ground in the parliamentary election Sunday and yesterday, according to partial returns and computer projections made public early today.

title: Books of The Times
description: IN her first collection of essays since the, celebrated Slouching Towards Bethlehem (1968), Joan Didion tells us: Quite often during the past several years I have felt myself a sleep walker, moving through the world unconscious of high issues, oblivious to its data, alert only to the stuff of bad dreams, the children burning in the locked car in the supermarket parking lot, the bike boys stripping down stolen cars on the captive cripple's ranch, the freeway sniper who feels real bad about picking off the family of five, the hustlers, the insane, the cunning Okie faces that turn up in military investigations ... all the ignorant armies jostling in the night. Acquaintances read The New York Times, and try to tell me the news of the world. I listen to callin shows.

title: Behavior Clues Seen In Taste and Smell
description: PHILADELPHIA IN the basement of one of the country's most unusual research centers, a catfish undulates slowly in a glass tube, pacing a gentle flow of water. Wires connect the fish's heart to an electrocardiograph machine.

title: World News Briefs
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 4  Venezuela's governing Social Christian Party won an easy victory in yesterday's nationwide elections for city council representatives, the first. separate yoting for municipal authorities since 1948.

title: COMMODITIES
description: Talk of adverse weather for this year's crops and speculation about a possible tightening of world grain supplies pushed grain and soybean futures higher yesterday.

title: Fullerton State Nine Gains In College World Series
description: OMAHA, June 4 (AP)  Tim Wallach smacked a threerun homer and a runscoring single and Sam Favata rapped four hits as Fullerton State eliminated Arizona, 163, tonight in the college world series.

title: Rhodesians Attack in Mozambique
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, June 4 (AP)  The black majority Government attacked inside Mozambique today in its first assault on bases of black nationalist guerrillas since it took over from the white minority Government last week.

title: No HalfFare Offer Planned by T.W.A.
description: Trans World Airlines said yesterday that it had no plans to offer its passengers halffare coupons for later flights.

title: Corporate Bond Pace Picks Up
description: Corporate Bond Pace Picks UtCorporate bond financing, shucking off last week's Memorial Day inactivity, grew more active yesterday as investment bankers priced $360 million of securities to be sold today and worked to sell $400 million more.

title: Television
description: Morning

title: Venezuela Oil Output Up
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 4 (UPI)  Venezuela's crude oil production through May 30 this year averaged 2.3 million barrels a day, slightly more than an 18 percent increase over the same period last year, the Ministry of Energy and Mines said in its latest weekly newsletter.

title: OBSERVER barreling Toward 1980
description: Teddy is more fun than a barrel of senators. It really gets under Jimmy's skin. Like the time Jimmy was studying for his oil examination and these guys in teamster costumes came up and asked where he wanted them to out the barrel.

title: Supreme Court Roundup States Allowed to Specify Political Party's Structure
description: WASHINGTON, June 4The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that state does not necessarily violate the constitutional rights of political party members by requiring the party's state committee to conform to a specific structure.

title: BRITISH VOTE BRINGS NO HOPE FOR ULSTER
description: BELFAST, Northern Ireland, May 30  Although Britain's general election earlier this month brought signs of some major change to the rest of the country, it brought this sorely troubled. province almost nothing to relfeve the prospect of more confrontation and more violence.

title: Working Into the Night on the City's Budget
description: Mayor Koch wore a dour expression last night as William Devine, First Deputy Police Commissioner, went over figures at a Gracie Mansion meeting room. Seated at left was James R. Brigham Jr., city budget director. Standing were, from left, Deputy Mayors Herman Badillo, John LoCicero and Phillip I. Toia. Articles on page B3.

title: The City
description: 12,000 in Brooklyn Lose Buses in Strike

title: Dayan, in Egypt, Sees Sadat on Peace Issues, Affirms Israel's Policy
description: CAIRO, June 4 (Reuters)  Foreign Minister Moshe Dayan of Israel met today with President Anwar elSadat in the Suez Canal town of Ismailia, after making a tough affirmation of Israel's policy on the Palestinians and Jewish settlements in occupied Arab territories.

title: Javits Defends Objectivity Record
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Senator Jacob K. Javits said today he could not comment on what his wife, Marion, did or didn't do' in her business dealing with Iran. But he said that her activities had not diminished his own objectivity in the Senate.

title: Dollar's Strength Tied to Heavy Oil Buying
description: Heavy buying of oil and oil products in the world's open markets has been an important element in the recent strength of the dollar, senior officials of the Federal Reserve Bank of New York said yesterday.

title: Repaint the Guidelines
description: The Administration's guidelines for wages and prices are fading fast from the larger program to arrest inflation. essentially for three reasons:

title: Dear Knicks: Fans Offer Suggestions on Draft Picks
description: While Eddie Donovan, the general manager, and Red Holzman, the coach, have toured the country meeting with prospects, fans have inundated the Knicks with letters offering suggestions on which players to select with the team's three firstround choices in the National Basketball Association draft on June 25.

title: Racing Worry Is Undetectable Drugs
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  A pharmacology expert said today that drugs that are virtually undetectable were now available for race horses.

title: Turtle Deaths May Bring a Halt To Shrimping in Gulf of Mexico
description: HOUSTON, June 2  Turtle slaughters in the Gulf of Mexico have brought a warning that the waters might be closed to shrimping, which would lead to drastically increased prices to the consumer.

title: Study Backs Charge of Sexism in Medicine
description: ASTUDY of the professional behavior of a sample of West Coast doctors supports the charge that male physicians are sexist in their response to medical complaints from patients.

title: Deaths
description: HALLLeonard W. On June 2, 1979, of Lattingtown, N.Y., beloved husband of Gladys, father of H.W. Carroll, and the late Patricia Ford, alsc survived by seven grandchildren and one great grand daughter. Regoes service Christ Episcopal Church, Oyster Bay, N.Y., Wednesday 2 P.M. Interment private. In lieu of flowers, donations to your favorite charity would be apopreciated. Visiting hours Monday 79 P.M. and Tuesday 25 and 7.9

title: 3Month Bills Rise to 9.554%
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  Interest rates on Treasury bills rose slightly today, but remained below the high rates of midMay, the Government said.

title: Earthquake Rocks Sierra Madre
description: MEXICO CITY, June 4 (UPI)  An earthquake struck a wide area of the Sierra Madre in southeastern Mexico today, causine alarm but no iniuries. The Tacubaya Seismographical Institute said the tremor registered 5.6 on the openended Richter scale with its epicenter located 425 miles southeast of Mexico City in the jungles of Chiapas, near the state capital of Tuxtla Gutierrez.

title: Ballet Theater Considers Barvshnikov for Director
description: Mikhail Baryshnikov has emerged as the strongest candidate to succeed Lucia Chase as artistic director of American Ballet Theater. The company's board is expected to meet in two weeks to consider his appointment.

title: News Summary
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 5, 1979

title: Drop Forecast In Cereals Crop
description: ROME, June 4 (AP)  Poor weather in the Northern Hemisphere has forced the United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization to reduce its forecast of the size of the 1979 world cereal crop.

title: GOING OUT GUIDE
description: QUEEN IN THE PARLOR Rosalyn Tureck is internationally renowned for her Bach programs, performed on the harpsichord or piano and sometimes on both. The artist's personal research, however, discloses the smallervoiced clavichord as the more popular solo instrument of Bach's time, although it is unsuitable to today's large auditoriums.

title: Election Unit Bids Carter Repay $50,202 for 76 Race
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  The Federal Election Commission, after a twoandahalfyear audit, is asking President Carter to reimburse taxpayers for $50,202.94 spent in his 1976. general election camnaien.

title: Concert: Housing Symphony
description: N0E of the New York's busiest community musical organizations for the last eight years, the New York City Housing Authority Symphony Orchestra, appeared in Alice Tully Hall on Sunday afternoon for its annual fancy concert. Usually this orchestra. under the direction of Karl Hampton Porter, may be heard playing in far less formal surroundings  on the lawns and in the halls of the authority's projects bringing music to New York neighborhoods that might not otherwise be exposed to symphonic concerts.

title: JOSEPH TAFFET
description: Joseph Taffet, a retired professor of economics at the City College of New York, died of a heart ailment Sunday at Union Hospital in the Bronx. He was 72 years old and lived at 555 Kappock Street in the Riverdale section of the Bronx.

title: Belmont Ball: Silks and Turf
description: The local sod was so sodden that 4,000 square feet of somewhatlesswaterlogged turf had to be flown in at the last mute from upstate; and as the party started, workmen were still hammering boards for the paddock fence and raking sawdust around the track, while be eweiea women and blacktied men fled toward the bar. But then again, the breathless arewegoingtomakeit atmosphere seemed entirely appropriate to an event celebrating a horse race.

title: Electrical Suit Settlement
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  The Justice Department announced today that a tentative settlement had been reached in a twoyearold pricefixing case involving seven manufacturers of electrical wiring devices.

title: Bond Offer Extended At Boston and Maine
description: The trustees of reorganization of the Boston and Maine Corporation said that, through the close of business last Friday, a total of $35.5 million principal amount of the company's first mortgage bonds 6 percent series TT due 1970 had been tendered for purchase under the trustees purchase offer.

title: Ferryboat Smokers Think New Ban Is a Bit Overboard
description: There were clouds of fog outside and clouds of cigarette smoke inside the Staten Island ferryboats yesterday, the day smoking was banned for the first time since Cornelius Vanderbilt started ferry service between Manhattan and Staten Island 168 years ago.

title: Sports News Briefs
description: JERSEY CITY, June 4 (AP)  Joe Coviello, the football coach at St. Peter's College, announced his retirement today after 38 seasons of coaching. He spent the last five years at St. Peter's.

title: Science Library
description: Since the discovery, early in the last century, that the vast gravel, sand and rock deposits of Northern Europe and such features as Long Island and Cape Cod in North America were formed by relatively recent ice ages, scientists have debated their cause.

title: U.S. IS EASING RULES ON CLEAN AIR TO AID NOLEAD CAS OUTPUT
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 The Carter Administration, acknowledging that it faced a dilemma in choosing between the desire for clean air and the clamor for more gasoline, relaxed its airquality standards today to allow an increase in the production of unleaded gasoline.

title: Article 3 -- No Title
description: Competing on muddy track at Belmont yesterday, Delta Leader (6) took lead at first turn and won third race ahead of Term Paper, on rail, and Laddy's Luck.

title: John Becomes First 10Game Winner in 83 Decision
description: Those were the same old Kansas City Royals the Yankees entertained at Yankee Stadium last night, the same Royals the Yankees have frustrated three years running in the American League pennant playoffs.

title: Horner, His Dispute Settled, Stays a Brave
description: Bob Homer, the National League rookie of the year last season, will be staying in Atlanta, which he finds disappointing. However, he will also be. come the highest paid secondyear player in baseball history, which he finds consoling.

title: TV: The Tony Show Moves With Punch and Elan
description: FOR those, including myself, who like their awards shows clean, crisp and brisk, Sunday evening's The 33d Annual Tony Awards demonstrated conclusively that it can indeed be done. With Alexander H. Cohen as executive prouducer. the CBSTV special, like any good trouper, got on and off in about an hour and 45 minutes, with a minimum of visible fuss and a generous quota of showbusiness wallop.

title: The Region
description: A team of surgeons in Montreal completed a delicate 15hour operation late last night on 11yearold Elizabeth McFadden, intended to restore sensation and mobility to her leg, which was severed by a Long Island Rail Road train and reattached by surgeons last Dec. 31.

title: Gielgud and Wajda Find JOin t Production Enhances Creativity
description: WARSAW ONE of the great actors of the English language and the ieading director of the Polish cinema have teamed .up here on a joint production that each believes is expanding the scope of his creative abilities. I've always honed to work with one of the big directors, you know, Antonioni or Fellini or Truffaut or Wajda, but they've never asked me, said the rich, somewhat wistful, pearshapedvoice of the English gentleman that belongs to Sir John Gielgud.

title: Ship is Abandoned in New York Bay
description: At Pier 62 on the Hudson River at 23d Street yesterday, the 164foot, Panamanianregistered Cap Saumon was examined by officials of the United States Customs Service. The freighter's holds were neatly battened down with yellow tarpaulins, with nothing inside, when she was found abandoned at anchor in Upper New York Bay. According to the Coast Guard, the Cap Saumon arrived in the harbor on May 4 to take on fuel and supplies. But, unable to post a required $10,000 bond to make the purchases, the ship remained at anchor until  one by one  its crew drifted off. It's the strangest thing I've ever seen, said Carl Del Campo, regional commander of the Customs Service's marine branch, who had no idea why the ship was abandoned and was searching for someone to claim her. Panama is just a flag of convenience, he said, and it could be owned by anyone, anyplace in the world.

title: IN THE NATION How To Help The Bishop
description: Now that Bishop Muzorewa is in power in Zimbabwe Rhodesia and Ian Smith is more or less out, the new Prime Minister and his Government have three highpriority tasks  none of which would be aided by American action to lift economic sanctions.

title: Around the Nation
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (AP)  Senator Herman E. Talmadge's chief accuser insisted under a probing examination today that Mr. Talmadge was completely informed of all campaign contributions and expense checks that were diverted to a secret bank account.

title: New Approaches Sought in War on Pests
description: THE number of insect and animal pests that have become immune to pesticides is rising swiftly and poses grave future problems for both world health and global food production, the United Nations Environmental Program warned today.

title: Harlem Studio Museum Searching for a Home
description: Board members of the Studio Museum in Harlem are walking around that community looking for a new home. But even though they have about a quarter of a million dollars to spend, their search so far has been in vain. At a recent board, meeting, the agenda was still headed by the question of new building for the museum, which has thrived for 11 years atop a liquor store and a luncheonette, and is now considered a principal center for the study of black art in the country.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Andrew A. DiPrate has been nominated by President Carter to fill the Republican seat on the Federal Home Loan Bank Board, but the post of chairman of the agency, which regulates the savings and loan industry, still remains unfilled.

title: Publisher Is a Supporter of South Africa
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 4  It was just after his attempt to buy The Washington Star had failed in 1974 that John P. McGoff turned up paying $7.75 million for The Sacramento Union, a failing paper that was sick almost unto death.

title: ...No. Just For Fairness.
description: HARRISBURG, Pa.  Cries of doom have arisen from newsrooms in reaction to the Supreme Court decision in the case of former Lieut. Col. Anthony Herbert, who contends that he was libeled on a 60 Minutes program which cast doubt on his charges that Army officers had covered up atrocities by American troops in the Vietnam War.

title: Companies List Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) Indicates stock Is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange end (O) overthecouater.

title: Bantam, in New Strategy, Cuts Price on Key Novels
description: Bantam Books Inc., the country's largest publisher of paperback books, is slashing the cover price of two of its big upcoming novels, in response to spreading consumer resistance to the substantial increase in book prices.

title: Toying With a Flying Cylinder
description: IN the history of flight, first came the paper airplane, then the Frisbee and now the cylindrical wing. In the history of flight, first came Icarus, then the Wright Brothers and nowGary R. Login.

title: 9 Nominees Selected by Carter For Judgeships in Federal Courts
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (UPI)  President Carter nominated eight men and one woman today to be Federal judges.

title: The Court's For Mind Control...
description: As one who has been indicted, convicted and has served time for thinking, I was interested in the Supreme Court decision in the case of Herbert v. Lando, which established that newsmen must reveal their thoughts and motives in libel proceedings.

title: TV: Fun for Glenn Ford in Old West
description: A PASSEL of television sagebrush performers of yesteryear saddle up and mosey down the old nostalgia trail tonight. Viewers who go along for the ride with When the West Was Fun, which will be shown from 10 to 11 o'clock on ABCTV, ought to have mighty nice time.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor:

title: Astros Take 7th in Row On Rookie's 6Hitter, 30
description: HOUSTON, June 4 (UPI)  Randy Niemann, a rookie, hurled a sixhitter for his first majorleague shutout tonight as the Houston Astros posted their seventh straight victory, beating the Philadelphia Phillies. 30.

title: Issue and Debate
description: After years of searching for ways and means to finance their programs and facilities, amateur sports in the United States have been discovered by large corporations. Yesterday. for ex ample, th United States Olympic Cornmjttee announced that the Data General Corporation had donated a $250,000 computer to the committee's biomechanics program.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: ABC Pictures International Inc., a division of ABC Inc., has named S. Arthur Schimmel vice president and general manager.

title: Play: Rumanians Present The Lost Letter at Yale
description: NEW HAVEN  Liviu Ciulei has made his American reputation as an adventurous stage director with productions of such plays as Spring Awakening at the Juilliard Theater Center in New York and Hamlet at the Arena Stage in Washington. In addition to being a member of the new sixman directorate at New. York's Vivian Beaumont Theater, he is the head of the Lucia Sturdza Bulandra Theater, a leading Rumanian repertory company that includes Andrei Serban among its alumni.

title: Isuzu Motors In U.S. Effort
description: TOKYO, June 4 (AP)  Isuzu Motors, one of Japan's major auto makers, will establish its own distribution system in the United States following the decision last week by the General Motors Corporation to stop selling Isuzu cars, it was reported today.

title: Bonwit Seeks to Return To a Fifth Avenue Site
description: Bonwit Teller, which officially closed its flagship store two weeks ago after 49 years on Fifth Avenue at 56th Street, will try to reopen this fall four blocks to the south.

title: Excerpts From Pope's Homily at Polish Monastery
description: CZESTOCHOWA, Poland, June (AP)  Following are excerpts from the prepared text of a homily delivered by Pope John Paul II today during a pontifical mass at Jasna Gora Monastery. The Pope spoke in Polish, and this is the official Vatican translation.

title: Output of Steel Down in Week
description: Steel production for the week ended last Saturday totaled 2.919 million tons, down onehalf of 1 percent from the 2.933 million tons produced in the week before, the American Iron and Steel Institute reported yesterday.

title: Record Sonnenberg Art Sale Opening
description: The Benjamin Sonnenberg collection, the largest collection of art and antiques auctioned by Sotheby Parke Bernet of New York, begins today at 2 P.M. When the gaveling ceases Saturday afternoon, the 1.762 paintings. drawings and antiques are expected to bring $3 million to $4 million, the third highest total for a singleowner sale in the auction concern's history.

title: Rock: Lou Reed, Serious
description: WITH an almost predictable regularity, Lou Reed seems to swing back and forth between seriousness and perversity in both his records and his concerts. His latest album. The Bells, is one of his serious works, and to judge from a healthy portion of the first set Sunday at the Bottom Line the beginning of a fournight, soldout engagement at that club  his current shows are serious, too.

title: Release for 2 Pilots Signed
description: BOGOTA, Colombia, June 4 (UPI)  The governor of La Guajira State in northern Colombia signed a release order. today for two Texas pilots held there since April 29. William Spradley, a Hous ton fireman, and Roy McLemore, who said they were on a flight to pick up oil drilling parts, made a forced landing in an area known as a marijuanasmuggling center and were charged with violating Colombian air space. Fines of more than $35,000 were paid on Friday, but the men had to stay under guard until Gov. Rafael iguaran signed the release order. said they were on a flight to pick up oil drilling parts, made a forced landing in an area known as a marijuanasmuggling center and were charged with violating Colombian air space. Fines of more than $35,000 were paid on Friday, but the men had to stay under guard until Gov. Rafael iguaran signed the release order.

title: City Near an Agreement to Lease Rikers I. to State for $200 Million
description: New York City and state officials are on the verge of a final agreement to lease the city's prisons on Rikers Island to the state for 99 years for $200 million, according to sources close to the negotiations.

title: Stephan J. Blaut Dies; TanningConcern Head
description: Stephan J. Blaut, a lawyer who was head of a family leathertanning business that was founded in Europe, died Sunday of cancer at St. Luke's Hospital in Manhattan. He was 64 years old and lived at 201 East 62d Street.

title: Coaching Findings. May Change S.A.T.
description: THE coaching controversy over the Scholastic Aptitude Test may be taking a new direction, with the College Entrance Examination Board and the Educational Testing Service showing willingness to consider the possibility that the test may not be as coachproof as they had insisted it was.

title: GHANA REBELS SAY COUP IS UNDER !IAY
description: LOME, Togo, June 4 (AP)  Rebel air force officers in Ghana today ousted the military regime of Lieut. Gen. Frederick W. K. Akuffo and threatened to bomb loyalists barricaded in the Accra police headquarters, according to radio broadcasts monitored :here. Earlier reports from Accra, the capital of Ghana, indicated that the cour had failed.

title: Notes on People
description: Joan Little has signed a ontract with the North Carolina Department of Correction under which, in exchange for her promise not to become involved in infractions and difficulties in the state women's prison in Raleigh, she will be paroled in October. Kenneth W. Harris, administrator of the prison, said Miss Little was doing an excellent job toward rehabilitation and getting high marks in a cosmetology course she is taking.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: FLAWLESS PERFORMANCE: Nadia Comaneci completing a somersault during floorexercise competition at World Cup gymnastics championships yesterday in Tokyo. Miss Comaneci received a perfect score of 20 points for her performance. She also captured the vaulting event yesterday.

title: Promoting Waters Of an Upstate Well
description: At last we New Yorkers have a strong entry to root for in the war of the springs  Saratoga Naturally Sparkling Mineral Water. It is from a venerable upstate well and is enhanced by its new owner and a new bottling method.

title: S. A. Hirshowitz, State Aide, Dies
description: Samuel A. Hirshowitz, who served as an assistant attorney general for New York State during major consumerfraud and monopoly investigations over three decades, died Sunday night at the Mount Sinai Hospital after a heart attack. He was 77 years old and lived at 3611 Henry Hudson Parkway in the Bronx.

title: Energy Dept. Officials List Minor Oil Links
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Reports filed by Secretary of Energy James R. Schlesinger and his principal subordinates showed today that these senior officials had little financial connection with the oil industry or other industries producing energy.

title: Dance: Sallie Wilson
description: IN her quiet way, Sallie Wilson, a principal dancer with the American Ballet Theater, has etched herself indelibly on the consciousness of the New York balletgoing public. Who can forget her Hagar patting her hair in Pillar of Fire? Her Lizzie's hesitant walk in Fall River Legend? The arch of that eloquent back in the Two Cities duet from The River?

title: Carter Discord With Congress
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  When the Carter people first came to town, they asked some old Washington hands for advice. One suggestion they received was, Don't sell the Senunia.

title: French Official Presses Criticism Of U.S. Subsidy on Heating Oil
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  France's Foreign Minister complained to President Carter today that a subsidy of $5 a barrel on imports of heating oil tends to divert toward the United States a larger share of the oil sold on the world market.

title: Cannon's Goal: New Ventures
description: KANNAPOLIS, N.C.  The Cannon Mills Company, traditionally a heavywight name in towels and sheets, is seeking broader markets as part of a diversificationandacquisition strategy that could find the familiar Cannon trademark on such things as kitchen utensils, dishes, bathroom towel racks and tissue dispensers.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: ANNOUNCEMENTS OF DEATHS MAY BE TELEPHONED TO 3543900 UNTIL 5:30 P.M. FOR WEEKDAY EDITIONS. UNTIL 2:30 P.M. ON SATURDAY FOR SUNDAY EDITION. IN REGIONAL OFFICES 9:00 A.M. TO 4:30 P.M. MONDAY THROUGH FRIDAY; NEW JERSEY (201) MARKET 33900; WESTCHESTER CO. AND NORTHERN NEW YORK STATE COUNTIES (914) WHITE PLAINS 95300; NASSAU CO. (516) 7470500; SUFFOLK CO. (516) 6691800; CONNECTICUT (203) 3487767.

title: Pope's Gift: A Skillful Use of Language and History
description: CZESTOCHOWA, Poland, June 4 Many Poles with a sharp ear for the political and social nuances of church messages here have been delighted with what they see as Pope John Paul II's clever use of language and church history to serve both spiritual and secular needs in Poland.

title: CREDIT MARKETS
description: The credit markets slipped in price early yesterday and then recouped the little ground they had lost to close almost unchanged from Friday. These minor swings took place on very light trading activity, dealers reported.

title: Pope Says Mass, Leads Folk Songs And Draws Cheers at Polish Shrine
description: CZESTOCHOWA, Poland, June 4 Pope John Paul II took his emotional homecoming pilgrimage to Poland's most revered shrine today and, on a sunbaked hillside thronged with a half million fellow Poles, celebrated mass, led folk songs and raised tumultuous cheers with appeals for peace and human rights.

title: About New York
description: Pegeen Fitzgerald is looking out into the greenblack night of Central Park, her pale beauty reflected in the wide window glass 16 stories above the city.

title: PRISONER ACQUITTED IN SEX SLAYINGS DIES
description: McALESTER, Okla., June 4 (AP) Gene Leroy Hart, acquitted in March of the sex slayings of three Girl Scouts, died tonight while exercising in,the Oklahoma State Penitentiary yard here, a prison official said.

title: Holdout Protesters Jailed In L.I. Nuclear Encounter
description: YAPHANK, L.I., June 4  Fortyfive of the 571 protesters who were arrested yesterday for trespassing on the construction site bf the Long Island Lighting Company's nuclear power plant in Shoreham, were taken to the Suffolk County Jail in Riverhead early today after they refused to identity themselves to the Suffolk County Police.

title: Legal Maneuvers Drop Auaand for Navel Error
description: The $850,000 malpractice award Virginia OHare received for her offcenter bellybutton was reduced yesterday to $200,000.

title: Connors Subdues Orantes
description: PARIS, June 4  Jimmy Connors and Chris Evert Lloyd swept to victory in the $485,000 French open tennis tournament today, and Gene Mayer surged ahead of Guillermo Vilas; 57, 61, 76, as darkness halted play.

title: Indian State Fights Delhi On Cow Protection Law
description: TRIVANDRUM, India, May 31  The lush, tropical state of Kerala along the fabled Malabar Coast, where King Solomon's sailors are said to have come for ivory, apes and peacocks, is locked in a bitter battle with the Federal Govern ment over a proposed national ban on killing cows, a sacred animal to orthodox Hindus.

title: Roosevelt I. Developer to Enlarge Project by 1,000 Housing Units
description: The second phase of the community development of Roosevelt Island in the East River was announced yesterday by the Starrett Housing Corporation.

title: Deaths
description: MELLONEleanor Mary, after a long illness, survived by two greet nephews, Darragh A. and James M. Park, the latter's children and those of her late great nephew, Charles H. Melton, III. The funeral will be held at St. Bartholomews Church, Park Ave. and 50th St., Wednesday, June 6, at 10:30 AM. Interment private. I n lieu of flowers, contributions may be sent to St.Luke's Hospital.

title: Credit Where Due
description: Diagrams of ancient Roman rooms, which appeared in Science Times April 24, were based on research and drawings by Edwin D. Thatcher, published in Memoirs of the American Academy in Rome in 1956.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Energy

title: Sue Flanagan, a Pioneer In Social Welfare Work
description: Sue Flanagan, a pioneer in New York City social welfare activities and a professor of sociology at New York University for two decades, died yesterday at Memorial Hospital in Worcester, Mass., after a brief illness. She was 88 years old and had lived at 1 University Place in Manhattan until entering the Peoples Church Nursing Home in Worcester three weeks ago.

title: Taxes
description: WHILE the Wages of sin are well known, virtue, alas, is apparently Its own reward. That at least was the message implicit in a pair of tax rulings that the Internal Revenue Service issued a week or so ago on dieting and quitting smoking. The rulings drew a sharp line on Uncle Sam's willingness to encourage, through tax deductions, the pursuit of the wholesome, slender life.

title: 27 Food Establishments Cited by Health Agency
description: The New York City Department of Health yesterday named 27 food establishments that it said had violated the Health Code. The department also named one restaurant that had corrected earlier violations and five that had been closed for failing to do so. Three restaurants reopened after correcting earlier violations.

title: Board Change Set At Friendly Frost
description: Friendly Frost Inc., the metropolitan area appliance and garden supply chain that has operated at a loss in recent years, said yesterday that it had reached an agreement for the sale by it and two of its directors of an aggregate of 209,200 shares of its stock to a group of investors who will, on consummation of the sale, take command of the board and become directors and officers. The company has slightly more than a million shares outstanding.

title: Market Place
description: THE 4for1 stock split of the International Business Machines Corporation was effective last Friday, and those who have been buying and selling 100share lots right along must be upset about the commission rate on a roundlot trade on a splitshare basis.

title: 2,000 Protest to Keep Plant Open
description: HAMTRAMCK, Mich., June 4 (AP) Nearly 2,000 demonstrators took to the streets of this Detroit suburb yesterday to protest the planned closing of a Chrysler Corporation assembly plant. Many of the demonstrators were members of the United Automobile Workers. The plant, which employs 5,000 persons, is scheduled to close next summer. demonstrators were members of the United Automobile Workers. The plant, which employs 5,000 persons, is scheduled to close next summer.

title: Two Australians Pose a Threat To Reigning Queens of the Court
description: PARIS, June 4  Two of the hottest players in women's tennis these days are both Australian, agile, daring and capable of beating Martina Navratilova, Chris Evert Lloyd and Tracy Austin on almost any surface. Together, Dianne Fromholtz and Wendy Turnbull form a competitive new ingredient on the women's circuit.

title: Advertising
description: THE economic outlook for the full year is somewhat uncertain but will probably turn out to have pretty good numbers, said Robert J. Coen, senior vice president of McCannErickson and a most respected seer of the advertising marketplace.

title: Pier Approval
description: Given the gasoline shortage, there is an especially benign logic in New York City's halfmilliondollar plan to turn seven falling piers and dismal waterfront lots into small parks from which people will be able look at the great harbor and the two rivers that made New York.

title: Soviet Proposes Talks With Chinese on Ties
description: MOSCOW, Tuesday, June 5 (UPI) The Soviet Union has proposed that Moscow and Peking open formal talks this summer aimed at improving their longstrained relations, Tass, the official press agency, reported today.

title: With Allagaroo And Bugs Bonny
description: In the beginning ther was sports and there was show biz. They have somehow married the two, these people at Warner Communications, and the result is the New York Cosmos. Their news conferences look as if central casting provided the bodies for a Fellini movie.

title: Ruling Broadens Scope Of Bankruptcy Courts
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  The Supreme Court ruled unanimously today that a Federal bankruptcy court, in deciding whether a bankrupt person can still be held liable for some of his debts, is not limited to a review of earlier proceedings in a lower state court, but can collect additional evidence on its own.

title: U.S. Says Israel Damages Peace By New Project
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  The United States said today that a decision by the Israeli Government to establish a new Jewish settlement on the occupied West Bank of the Jordan was harmful to the peace process in the Middle East and, coming at this time, was particularly regrettable.

title: Carl L. Bausch
description: Carl L. Bausch, former chairman of the Bausch & Lomb Optical Company, died Sunday at his home in Brighton, N.Y. He was 91 years old.

title: Voyager l Finds Stunning Variety on Jupiter's Moons
description: AFTER three months of examining the photographs and data from Voyager l's rendezvous with Jupiter, scientists have concluded that they have never seen anything in the solar system to compare to the four major Jovian moons Io. Europa. Ganvmede and Callisto  each a distinct world and a source of continuing surprise.

title: Hope for the Children of Limbo
description: There is hope at last that New York State will break away from the nation's shameful system of foster care. Some 33,000 children in the state, who already bear the scars of separation from their natural parents, have been cast into limbo by a system that holds them in temporary homes or institutions for years. Moreover, the system offers its greatest financial rewards to those who keep them from returning home or being formally adopted.

title: MAINTENANCE FLAWS IN DC10'S SUGGESTED
description: The National Transportation Safety Board raised the possibility for the first time yesterday that a questionable maintenance procedure may have been a primary cause of the American Airlines DC10 crash in Chicago on May 25.

title: Deaths
description: ABELESElsie H. On June 4, 1979. Wife of the late Maurice, devoted mother of AnneMarie Model and Arthur A.,loving sister of Hilde Bindeft, dear grandmother of Roger W. Kirby and Michele Abeles. Service Wednesday, 1PM at Temple ErnanuEL, 65 St & S Ave. Kindly omit flowers.

title: For the Elderly, Exploring Some Alternatives to the Nursing Home
description: Many professionals agree that when elderly people go through any major life change, touch as entering a nursing home, they are vulnerable to a crisis that can have physiological as well as psychological effects. And institutional care, these professionals believe, is not always the best way to help people deal with aging. They are looking for alternatives to institutions  and finding some.

title: Oil Find Off Curacao
description: CARACAS, Venezuela, June 4 (Reuters) The Venezuelan Oil Corporation has struck oil off the Dutch island of Curacao, its president, Juan Chacin, announced today. The offshore well. whose initial output was put at 2,200 barrels a day, was the first oil strike in a twoyear offshore exploration program aimed at increasing Venezuela's proven reserves of light and medium crudes.

title: PARKING REGULATIONS
description: Because of trashremoval problems during the tugboat strike, alternateside parking regulations will be in effect today and tomorrow in Manhattan and Queens only.

title: Theater: Chinchilla Is About a Dance Impresario
description: CHINCHILLA, a play about the Russian dance impresario Diaghilev, is either play buried from sight beneath its mannerisms; or else it is play consisting of nothing but mannerisms. It would take more probing than a single viewing and a short deadline can provide to decide which.

title: 25 Salvadoran Leftists in Cuba
description: SAN SALVADOR, June 4 (Reuters) Twentyfive leftist militants of the Popular Revolutionary Bloc who left here on Friday after having occupied the French and Venezuelan embassies are now in Cuba, a Government spokesman said today.

title: Florida Cities Lead In Housing Study
description: CHICAGO, June 4 (UPI)  The fastestgrowing markets for new housing in the nation last year were in Fort Myers, Fla., and West Palm Beach, Fla., with new homes there being built at a rate four times greater than the national average, according to a survey released today.

title: The Light Side of a Weighty Budget Parley
description: Scooping up potato salad with a knife, the only utensil in sight, Comptroller Harrison J. Goldin ate and complained to reporters whose food he was sharing that a new generation of fiscal jargon was confusing him.

title: Gun in Brooklyn Tied to Robbery And 4 Murders
description: James L. Allen, one of the principal suspects in the murder of four Bedford Bills residents May 10, was identified in State Supreme Court in Brooklyn yesterday as the man who was captured leavine the scene of a robbery in Brooklyn two weeks later holding the alleged murder weapon, a .32caliber automatic with a silencer.

title: Page Enters Guilty Plea In Uganda Sale Inquiry
description: Page Airways pleaded guilty yesterday to six violations of United States currency laws in connection with the transfer of $46,647 to Uganda to operate and service aircraft for the now deposed Government of Idi Amin.

title: Volume Off, OilTanker Rates Soar
description: LONDON, June 4  Rates for the very large crude carriers used to ship oil, known as V.L.C.C.'s, have climbed 50 to 70 percent in the last two weeks. And in an ironic twist of the law of supply and demand, the cause of the rise the indirect cause at least  is that the amount of oil being shipped worldwide has fallen significantly since the Iranian revolution last winter.

title: Brazil CoffeeExport Halt
description: RIO DE JANEIRO, June 4 (Reuters)  Brazil temporarily suspended coffee exports today, saying that last week's frost in its coffeegrowing areas was worse than first thought. Trade sources said that up to 20 percent of the 198081 crop may have been lost. The 197980 crop, which is about to be picked, has not suffered such losses, but its quality has suffered, they said.

title: Furor Over COty A wards
description: The Coty Awards are in trouble. After 37 years of honoring American designers for their contributions to the world of fashion, the awards themselves have been challenged on the basis of commercialism.

title: Q & A
description: Q. When a chicken egg is left outdoors in hot weather it spoils. Why doesn't this happen to eggs that birds lay in nests?

title: 13 Plead Guilty to Dumping PCB's in North Carolina
description: HALIFAX, N.C., June 4  Three New York men pleaded guilty today to state charges of damaging public property in connection with the dumping of the chemical PCB, polychlorinated biphenyls, along 210 miles of rural North Carolina highways last summer.

title: Plan to Increase Aid to Colleges Gains in Albany
description: ALBANY, June 4  Leaders of the Democraticled State Assembly have agreed to an increase in state aid to private colleges in return for the Senate Republican leadership's assent to a series of measures, including the state takeover of the City University of New York.

title: Final Prep For Bid
description: Spectacular Bid went a mile in 1:39 at Belmont Park yesterday in his last major workout for the 111th Belmont Stakes on Saturday.

title: Rod Carew to Be Sidelined 4 Weeks by Thumb Iniury
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., June 4 (AP) Rod Carew , seventime American League batting champion, will be out of action for about four weeks because of torn ligaments in his right thumb, a spokesman for the California Angels said today.

title: Bridge:
description: GOSIER, Guadeloupe, June 4  Royalty has not been easy to find in the French West Indies for the last two centuries, ever since a lady named Josephine departed from Martinique en route to becoming Napoleon's empress.

title: Dance: Divertimento 15 Returns to City Ballet
description: WE have become accus. tomed to the New York City Ballet's dictum that what is being danced is more important than who is dancing. It is easy to assume, then, that it doesn't matter who is dancing what.

title: Supreme Court Ruling May Send Addonizio, 2 Others Back to Jail
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  The Supreme Court today opened the way for a possible return to Federal prison of three New Jersey politicians who had been freed by Federal judges in New Jersey.

title: VORSTER, ACCUSED OF ROLE IN SCANDAL, QUITS AS PRESIDENT
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 4  President John Vorster resigned today as a report was released accusing him of giving false information about a scandal involving the spending of Government money on secret propaganda projects.

title: Mortgage Rates Exceed 11% Level
description: Interest rates on home mortgages are continuing to climb, the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation reported yesterday.
