The average yield on the mortgages it bought yesterday in its weekly pur. chases made to improve the li quidity of the home loan market topped 11 percent for the first time.

title: Engravers' Talks With Papers Go On
description: Negotiations continued beyond a 12:01 A.M. strike deadline this morning in an effort to avoid a threatened walkout by photoengravers at The Daily News and The New York Times.

title: Tourism, Nearing a Record, Fills New York Hotels.
description: New York City is enjoying these days what leaders of its tourist and convention industry are hailing as the biggest tourism boom in the city's history.

title: Second Trial Is Opened in Texas In Killings of 27 TeenAge Boys
description: CORPUS CHRISTI, Tex., June 4 (UPI)  The second trial of Elmer Wayne Her. ley, charged with participating in a Houston homosexual ring in which 27 teenagers were slain, opened today with indications that it might be two weeks before the first testimony could be heard.

title: For Museum Professionals, Inflation Is Topic A
description: CLEVELAND, June 4  Ready to grapple with a formidable array of topics, from Museum Leadership to Moral Aspects of Museums and the Disabled. 1.500 museum professionals have descended on this lakefront city, which itself boasts one of the world's great institutions, the Cleveland Museum of Art.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Disarmament Commission  10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: 109 Possible Oil Fraud Cases Cited
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  The Departments of Energy and Justice have identified 109 cases of possible fraud in the oil industry, some involving major companies, a Justice Department official testified today. They include alleged daisy chaining, illegal price manipulations and falsifying reports to the Government, he said. leged daisy chaining, illegal price manipulations and falsifying reports to the Government, he said.

title: Alabama School Boycott Provokes Dispute on Promotions of Students
description: The school board in Sumter County, Ala., is weighing the possibility of penalizing black participants in a 10week school boycott and of filing insubordination charges against teachers and principals who ordered the students promoted or graduated in defiance of school board orders.

title: Swiss Banks Riding Out Scandal
description: ZURICH, June 1  The storm that swept through Swiss banking in the wake of the 1977 scandal at the Chiasso branch of Crdit Suisse seems to have blown itself out. Today, just after the start of the somewhat anticlimatic trial in the spectacular $700 million fraud case, damage to the banks, lined al most vaulttovault along this city's Bahnhofstrasse, appears negligible.

title: Miss Sills in Premiere Of Men otti 's La Loca
description: SAN DIEGO, June 4  The ink was barely dry on the score when Gian Carlo Menotti's opera La Loca, tale of Juana, the mad Queen of Spain, opened for its world premiere here with Beverly Sills in the leading role.

title: U.S. Company Is Fined $52,647 For Violation of Currency Laws
description: WASHINGTON, June 4 (Reuters) An American concern was fined $52,647 today for illegally transferring funds to Uganda to support a cargo plane used by the Government of Idi Amin.

title: 2 Policemen Are Killed in Madrid
description: MADRID, June 4  Terrorists firing from a stolen taxi assassinated two civil guardsmen today as they were returning home for lunch in northeastern Madrid. The killings brought the number of political deaths in Snain this year to 80.

title: Science Watch
description: The National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration issued a sober report last week, finding that the level of carbon dioxide in the atmosphere is continuing to increase rapidly.

title: Swan Hurls 6Hitter, Outdueling Seaver For Fifth Victory
description: CINCINNATI, July 4  Tom Seaver's painful season grew more painful tonight when Craig Swan pitched the New York Mets to a 62 victory over the Cincinnati Reds and the onetime hero of Shea Stadium.

title: Marshall Expects Firm Jobless Rate
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  Secretary of Labor Ray Marshall said today that he expected unemployment to remain at about the current level in the coming months despite projections of an economic slowdown.

title: Rally in Boston Backs Commuting by Bicycle
description: BOSTON, June 4 (AP)  Three hundred bicyclists pedaled through downtown Boston in the morning rush hour today to prove, when it comes to commuting, that the bike is mightier than the automobile. Waving banners proclaiming, Relieve gas pains, ride a bicycle, two groups of riders met at City Hall Plaza for a rally to promote International Bicycle Day.

title: Broadway Ends Record Season
description: The Broadway theater set records in attendance and boxoffice revenue in the 197879 season, surpassing even the highwater mark achieved in the previous season. With an attendance of 9.8 million that yielded $136 million in ticket sales, the season was the sixth in a row that saw increases in both totals.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Supreme Court Acts to Uphold GuninCar Law
description: WASHINGTON, June 4  A New York law that allows a jury to presume that an illegal weapon found in a car belongs to all of the car's occupants does not necessarily violate the occupants constitutional rights, the United States Supreme Court ruled today.

title: ALABAMA EXTENDING STATUTE ON ALIMONY
description: MONTGOMERY, Ala., June 4  Faced with the prospect of a statewide default in alimony payments, the Alabama Court of Civil Appeals has taken the unusual step of extending Alabama's alimony statute to apply to men as well as to women.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Vorster: Apartheid Symbol and Exponent
description: As exponent and symbol of South Africa's policy of apartheid, Balthazar Johannes Vorster, who prefers the Anglicized version of his middle name, served 12 years as Prime Minister, succeeding Hendrik F. Verwoerd, who was assassinated in Parliament in 1966 ...

title: Cup Fetches $1 Million
description: LONDON, June 4  A Roman glass bowl, possibly made in the Rhineland in A.D. 300, was auctioned at Sotheby's here today for 520,000, or $1.04 million. It was bought by a local dealer, Robin Symes, who would not disclose. for whom he was dealing.

title: California Finding Proposition 13 Less Potent Than Was Predicted
description: LOS ANGELES, June 4  Last June 6, when Californians voted to slash property taxes by almost 60 percent, proponents and opponents alike said: the vote would touch off an economic revolution in California government that would cause a wholesale trimming of the public work force. But a year later, it is apparent that the Proposition 13 bombshell failed to ignite to the degree expected.

title: Japan Cup to Tottenham
description: TOKYO, June 4 (AP)  England's Tottenham Hotspur team won the Japan Cup international soccer championship today by defeating Dundee United of Scotland, 20, before a crowd of 30,000 at National Stadium.

title: The Polish Pope in Poland
description: The triumphant homecoming of Pope John Paul II is one of the remarkable events of current history. Poland is a Communistruled nation where MarxistLeninists have held undisputed secular power for more than 30 years. Yet now a Pontiff of the Roman Catholic Church receives a welcome such as few men have ever received anywhere. If Stalin were to come back from the grave this week, he would not dare ask, How many divisions does the Pope have?

title: Attica Inmate Is Slain During a Racial Brawl Involving 60 Prisoners
description: Inmates at the upstate Attica Correctional Facility remained locked in their cells yesterday, authorities said, after a racially motivated fight Sunday night led to the stabbing death of one prisoner and injuries to three others.

title: New Pro vincetown Playhouse Delayed Unti11981
description: PROVINCETOWN, Mass., June 4 The opening of the new Provincetown Playhouse will be delayed at least a year beyond the projected date of July 4, 1980, and the cost of the project has been revised from the original estimate of $1 million to at least $2.5 million, according to William Marlin, project coordinator.

title: Clark Is Swbrn In as Canadian Leader
description: OTTAWA, June 4  Joe Clark was sworn in today as the 16th and youngest national leader in Canadian history.

title: Simon Bochner, Textile Stylist, And Once a PlaySet Designer
description: Simon Bodmer, a textile stylist and an early leader in the field of printed upholstered fabrics, died Sunday at Doctors Hospital in New York. He was 62 and lived on Park Avenue.

title: Boarded Stores in Managua Mark Start of Strike Called by Guerrillas
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, June 4 (AP) Stores closed and streets were deserted in Managua today as Nicaraguans began a general strike aimed at deposing Presi- dent Anastasio Somoza Debayle.

title: Dr. McGill to Step Down At Columbia in July 1980
description: William J. McGill, the president of Columbia University since 1070, announced yesterday that he would step down at the end of the coming academic year.

title: Amex Index Reaches Peak While Dow Edges Up
description: Energy stocks with a stake in Canada rose yesterday to help propel the market value index of the American Stock Exchange to a new record. Meanwhile, bluechip and glamour issues continued to show minimal price changes.

title: Gasoline Supplies Now Adequate, But Only Temporarily, Dealers Say
description: Despite the gasoline shortage, motor ists throughout the New York metropoli tan area can now get gasoline to fill their tanks relatively easily, representatives of servicestation dealers said yesterday.

title: Suffolk County Police Given Raise of $3,500 Over TwoYear Period
description: An arbitrator has awarded the Suffolk County police a raise of nearly $3 million over the next two years, or about $3,500 per officer, and has rejected county efforts for a major increase in police productivity.

title: Letters
description: TO TIM LIVING SECTION:

title: Nuclear Plants Held Necessary As Con Ed Chief Criticizes Curbs
description: If present regulatory policies keep discouraging utility Investors, the Federal Government will have to finance, perhaps even build and operate nuclear plants that are increasingly necessary, Charles F. Luce, chairman of the Consolidated Edison Company, asserted yesterday.

title: Obituary 7 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Harvard Class of '54  Achievers Who Sleep Soundly at Night
description: CAMBRIDGE, MASS. WHILE the HarvardCollege class of '54 was in its sophomore year, two members named Paul H. R. Matisse and. Stephen J. Joyce had rooms cheek by jowl with one occupied by Prince Sadruddin Aga Khan, son of the then Aga Khan, the rich and portly spiritual leader of millions of adoring Moslems.

title: Careers
description: TECHNICAL writers are in growing demand, according to Dr. David Carson, program director of the technical .writing program at Rensselaer Polytechnic Institute in Trov. N.Y.

title: Obituary 6 -- No Title
description: Deaths

title: Polish Workers Say Regime Keeps Pope From Big Cities
description: CZESTOCHOWA, Poland, June 5 When a man wearing a goldbuttoned uniform and black shako with white plumes approached Pope John Paul II today at Jasna Gora monastery and raised a silverplated lantern and pick in the air in greeting, it was not just another daub of color from the dizzying paint box of a papal visit.

title: Advertising
description: TO the background music of sliding sales, the Adolph Coors Company, the largely familyowned brewery, opened the first heavy advertising campaign in its 106year history this week.

title: Market Place
description: RECENT action in the warrants of the Greyhound Corporation suggests that some investors may be unaware of the relative merit of Greyhound calls.

title: Court Reaffirms Support of Rule Banning Data Obtained Illegally
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Supreme Court used a New York murder case today to reaffirm its support of the controversial exclusionary rule, the doctrine that bars the use of illegally obtained evidence at a trial.

title: Builders of the Three Mile Island Reactor Blame Utility for Accident
description: LYNCHBURG, Va., June 5  Officials of Babcock & Wilcox, the company that built the Three Mile Island reactor, said today that they had changed some operating procedures and equipment but reiterated their position that they were blameless in the nation's worst commercial nuclear accident.

title: The Clowns Give channel 13 Serious Tips on Fun
description: There was what one might be tempted to call an emergency roundtable discussion yesterday to learn what 9/NETTV might be able to do to make viewers laugh. It's been a dozen years since they've created any sub. stantial comedy over there and now they feel they had better hurry up, if only because the Carnegie Commission and other serious fellows are after them t promote American humor.

title: Citicorp Note Rate Up
description: Citicorp, in its weekly auction, sold $100 million of 91day notes yesterday at an average rate of 10.112 percent, up slightly from 10.045 percent a week ago, the bank holding company reported. Bids totaling $684.25 million were submitted, and those accepted ranged in rate from 10 percent to 10.135 percent, including 17.5 percent of those made at the high rate.

title: 202d Session of Legislature Is Ending Amid Great Quiet
description: ALBANY, June 5  I'm harried and I'm bored, said Barbara Shack, a lobbyist for the New York Civil Liberties Union, as she slumped into a chair. How can I be harried and bored at the same time?

title: SOVIET ASKS CHINESE TO TALKS IN MOSCOW
description: MOSCOW, June 5  The Soviet Union has told China that it is ready to enter into negotiations aimed at normalizing relations, with the talks beginning here in July or August.

title: Health Plan of Carter Is Reported to Cover Medical Catastrophes
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI)  President Carter will propose to Congress next week a national health insurance plan that would provide catastrophic coverage for workers for expenses above $2,500, officials said today.

title: Democrats Question Data on Minorities
description: The New York Democratic state cornmittee has named a subcommittee to investigate the reliability of statistics that were to be used in apportioning black and Hispanic delegates to next year's Democratic National Convention under the party's affirmativeaction program.

title: Office Rents Found Up 50% in 2 Years
description: CHICAGO, June 5 (AP)  Office rents nationwide have increased by 50 percent In the last two years, mainly because there is not enough space, according to a report released today.

title: Entertaining: The Virtues Of Simplicity
description: BECAUSE I am involved with food as a chef and teacher, people  except for other professional chefs and close friends  hesitate, even fear, to invite me to dinner. As a matter of fact, like most my colleagues, although I recognize and appreciate quality, I am somewhat of a glutton and extremely easy to feed.

title: About Real Estate
description: In the world of real estate the foreign investor has appeared in the last few years as a knight in armor, capable of vaulting oceans, ignoring market values and rescuing problematic Properties and economies.

title: Suffolk Official. Denies Brutality By Police Force
description: YAPHANK, L.I., June 5  Replying to charges that the Suffolk County police had brutalized suspects to the point where they confessed crimes they had not committed, the County Police CommisIsioner, Donald Dilworth, said today that strict departmental discipline instituted since he took office had made such conduct very unlikely.

title: U.S. Issues Regulations On Age Discrimination
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI)  The Government today issued final regulations to see that all programs and activities receiving Federal money do not discriminate on the basis of age.

title: ExAir Force Man Plays It Cool In Winning $2 Million in Lottery
description: Robert Urban does not get excited easily  even when he wins $2 million in New York State's Olympic Lottery.

title: Problems for Video  Recorders
description: CHICAGO, June 4  Manufacturers and sellers of home video recording equipment fear that just as their products appear headed for broad public acceptance the advent of new techmologies may hopelessly fragment consumer demand.

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 5, 1979

title: Undermining Public Schools
description: Senator Moynihan says he will renew his fight on behalf of tuition tax credits for parents who send their children to private schools. A similar effort was frustrated last year when the House Ways and Means Committee struck the measure from a collegeaid bill that itself subsequently went down to defeat. The Senator has persistently argued the case for tax credits, always with his customary eloquence and fervor; but not even his debater's skill overcomes the constitutional objections or the dangers of such a policy.

title: Around the Nation
description: PIERRE, S.D., June 5 (UPI)  The prairie grass is dancing, but there is no wind. Wheat from the soil is disappearing and cows are slipping in mudless fields. The grasshoppers are back.

title: 40 Police 'superclans Meets Again
description: We used to bring our shorts and sneakers and baseball bats; said Sidney F. Gage. Now we come mainly to talk to each other and renew old friendships. A deputy chief in the New York City Police Department, he was attending the annual reunion of the Police Academy's class of 1940.

title: Ballet: Don Quixote
description: AMERICAN Ballet Theater's Don Quixote presented Cynthia Gregory as Kitri and Fernando Bujones as Basil for the first time this season Monday night at the Metropolitan Opera House. The restilt was on the dull side although intermittently sparked by excellent dancing.

title: Minority Concern Gets U.S. Loan Aid
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) The Government has agreed to guarantee almost $5.5 million in loans to a food company, making it the largest loan guarantee ever made for a minorityowned firm, the Commerce Department said today. The American Pouch Food Company of Willowbrook, Ill., plans. to buy and rehabilitate two plants in Chicago, creating 475 jobs.

title: Donkeys Get Vasectomies And Escape a Worse Fate
description: OSSABAW ISLAND, Ga.  The Sicilian donkeys of Ossabaw Island don't seem overly appreciative of the concern that has been shown for them. they would want to do, and most of them didn't really see much choice in that, so I called a local vet and asked him about vasectomies for the donkeys. I think he fainted.

title: Profits Decline At Van Heusen
description: The PhillipsVan Heusen Corporation, a leading maker of men's and boys clothing and an Operator of retail chains, reported yesterday that net earnings fell to $985,855. or 31 cents a share, in the first fiscal quarter ended May 31 from $2.3 million, or 75 cents a share, in the similar three months a year earlier.

title: Heart Attack Is Blamed in Death Of Convict Cleared in Scout Case
description: OKLAHOMA CITY, June 5  Gene Leroy Hart, the 35yearold Cherokee Indian acquitted March 30 in the slayings of three Girl Scouts from the Tulsa area, died yesterday of acute coronary disease, according to Dr. A. J. Chapman, Oklahoma's chief medical examiner.

title: Cinderblock Kills Queens Woman;May Have Been Thrown Off Roof
description: The police were investigating yesterday the death of a 25yearold model who was struck by a piece of cinderblock they believe was thrown by a teenager playing on the roof of her apartment building in the Whitestone section of Queens.

title: Photoengravers Union Strikes The News, Preventing Paper's Publication
description: Unionized photoengravers struck The Daily News early yesterday, preventing publication of today's issue

title: Issue and Debate
description: WASHINGTON; June 5  President Carter is approaching a selfimposed deadline for a decision on Zimbabwe Rhodesia that is expected to greatly affect his standing with Congress and United States relation with Africa.

title: Questions Are Raised on MMT Effects
description: WASHINGTON, June 5A research scientist who specializes in neurological disorders and a newly completed joint study by the automobile and gasoline industry have raised questions about the effect on health and the environment of MMT, a gasoline additive whose summer use was approved yesterday by the Carter Administration.

title: Books of The Times
description: ONE read the final pages of Particulars of My Life, the first volume of B.F. Skinner's autobiography, with mixed feelings. On the one hand. a gloomy suspicion arose. Here was Mr. Skinner, the perpetual tinkerer, completing a dark postcollege year in which he had. tried and failed to become a novelist. At the end, he decides that for all their skill at imitating human behavior, writers like Proust and Dostoyevsky didn't really understand people. So he plans to go off to graduate school at Harvard and devise a new psychology. Which makes one wonder whether that radical form of behaviorisrn he would refine at Harvard was nothing more than revenge on the literary vocation that had frustrated him.

title: Supermarkets Versus Health Shops: Prices Compared
description: AS food costs rise, so does the price of a healthy diet. And for conscientious shoppers who desire foods free of preservatives, additives and potentially hazardous chemicals and want a diet rich in natural whole grains, fruits and nuts, eating well for less is ever more a challenge.

title: Arabs Cut West Bank City Services To Mark Anniversary of 1967 Was
description: RAMALLAH, IsraeliOccupied West Bank, June 5  Municipal workers in this Arab center north of Jerusalem and in other nearby towns and villages stayed away from their jobs today to mark the 12th anniversary of the 1967 war in which Israel conquered the West Bank and the Gaza Strip.

title: Possible Fraud in Carrier Deal
description: The United Technologies Corporation disclosed yesterday that the Securities and Exchange Commission might bring fraud charges against it in connection with its $1 billion pending takeover of the Carrier Corporation.

title: World News Briefs
description: China and Hanoi Exchange Sick and Injured Prisoners

title: Entertainment Events
description: LOOSE ENDS, by Michael Weller, Circle In the Square, 50th Street west of Broadway, 6:30.

title: Obituary 3  No Title
description: REMO J. IANNUCCI

title: Khomeini Warns Secular Critics Not to Fight Islam
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 5  Ayatollah Ruhollah Khomeini used the 16th anniversary of the beginning of his revolt against the Shah for a counterattack against his critics today.

title: G.M. AND U.S SETTLE EMISSIONSTEST SUIT
description: DETROIT, June 5  A controversial Federal investigation into whether the General Motors Corporation illegally tampered with auto emissioncontrol equipment to assure certification by Federal inspectors has been settled out of court, the United States Attorney's Office here said today.

title: 60Minute Gourmet
description: THERE is an interesting legend behind the quickly made chicken dish that will be discussed here. In its original form the dish was called ,chicken Marengo and was served to Napoleon on the day he defeated the Austrians near the Italian village of Marengo in

title: Rebel Officers in Ghana Say They Are in Firm Control
description: NDJAMENA, Chad, June 5  Ghana radio reported today that junior officers were firmly in control of the Government a day after the overthrow of the ruling Supreme Military Council.

title: Commercials Chiding Congress Planned by Connecticut Group
description: Radio listeners in the Waterbury, Conn., area who call Jay Clark's talk show to complain about the Federal Government know that at 5,000 watts, WATRAM cannot carry their voices all the way to Washington. So they raised $2,400 to buy commercials on a Washington radio station to make themselves heard in the halls of Congress.

title: Delays on Subways Plague Riders
description: Thousands of Brooklyn and Manhattan subway riders were stranded for up to ar hour yesterday by an unrelated series mechancial problems and a fight be twe two passengers during the evening rush hour.

title: G.M.Spain Pact Reported
description: MADRID, June 5 (AP)  The General Motors Corporation and the Spanish Government have reached a general agreement for G.M. to build a $461 million plant in Spain, a senior Spanish official said today.

title: The U.N. Today
description: June 8 1979

title: Rebels Control City in Nicaragua
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, June 5 (AP) Sandinist guerrillas today controlled the streets of Leon, Nicaragua's second largest city, and kept National Guardsmen pinned down in their garrison with heavy gunfire, witnesses reported.

title: 947 MILLION ACCORD ON TRANSPORTATION IS GAINED IN ALBANY
description: ALBANY, June 5  Governor Carey and top legislators agreed today to a $947 million package of transportation improvements, including a 5500 million bond issue to be put before the voters this fall. At the same time, the leaders of the Legislature agreed to increase aid to public schools by $58.35 million, including $12 million for New York City, and Governor Carey was expected to approve the move.

title: Austrian Government Sworn In
description: VIENNA, June 5 (Reuters)  Austria's new Socialist Government, headed by Chancellor Bruno Kreisky, was sworn in by President Rudolf Kirchschlger today for another fouryear term.

title: Chess:
description: Keeping queens on the board is often not a consideration in positional play. One may kill a mating attack by removing the highest powered pieces, out in a positional battle, where pawn structure and subtle differences in piece mobility are the paramount factors, queens can be dispensed with.

title: The Updike Report
description: IN the month after graduation, I was fortunate enough to have a poem and a short story accepted by The New Yorker, and for the 25 years since I have been writing for a living, often for that magazine. imagine I have published more books than any other member of our Class but Jack Neusner may have me beaten there.

title: DISCOVERIES
description: Weddings are in style again. The traditional kind with flowerdecked pews and Lohengrin and Mendelssohn and the family wiping away furtive tears. A sentimental bride should like the Victorian accessories at La Fleuressence: a bouquet of white silk flowers to keep forever; a lacy heirloom handkerchief and a white crocheted bag to hold it; garters of old lace, with the something blue a tiny pocket for a lucky penny; a crocheted pillow for the wedding ring; a book of love poems illustrated with pressed flowers and covered in crochet work. Charming gifts for a bridal shower. The shop is at 1240 Madison Avenue (89th Street).

title: Television
description: Morning

title: GAF Dedicates Plant in Ireland
description: The GAF Corporation said that it had formally dedicated a new $30 million sheetvinylflooring plant in Mullingar, Ireland. Dr. Jesse Werner, chairman and chief executive officer, said that the 400,000squarefoot plant would permit the company to compete more vigorously in the expanding $400 million European sheetvinylflooring market.

title: Back to Wood. Back to Paper.
description: RIDGEFIELD, Conn.  In America today, an ocean of petroleum byproducts is being gulped by plants manufacturing millions of disposable plastic knives, forks, plates and scores of other products which once were made from replaceable resources such as wood. Every month, millions of barrels of oil go into supplying the steadily growing plastics industry, many of whose disposable products go into littering our streets and parks.

title: Kitchen Equipment
description: WHEN the Cuisinart came along in 1973, a great many home cooks persuaded themselves that Rich a machine was well worth its $175 price and that it would be barbaric to chop, slice, pure or grate Without one. Then, as recall, many of them stored their food processors permanently and told each other jokesabout all the things they weren't doing with their Cuisinarts.

title: Price Index Up in Italy
description: ROME, June 5 (AP) Italy's index of wholesale prices rose 1.6 percent in April, the National Statistics Institute reported today, compared with March gain of 1.5 percent. The index is not seasonally adjusted. The rise totaled 12.9 percent in the 12 months ended April 30.

title: Letters
description: A Chance on Election Day for the NotSoRich

title: TaxExempt Bonds Sold At Lowest Yields of Year
description: Investment bankers offered highgrade taxexempt bonds to investors yesterday at the lowest yields so far in 1979, and the bonds sold quickly. The implication of the market's behavior was that interest rates on state and city bonds would continue to move downward.

title: Residential Fuel Is Reported Sold In Area. as Diesel
description: Some service stations in Brooklyn and in Westchester County were recently offered home heating oil to sell as diesel fuel, according to reports under investigation by the New York State Attorney General's office.

title: Digest
description: A Federal judge in Washington will bold hearings on whether to ground all DC10 jetliners until the cause of the recent Chicago crash is found. He initially ordered the Federal Aviation,Administration to ground all of the DC10's, but later` agreed; to hold a rehearing this morning. The order was issued at the request of the Airline Passengers Association, a consumer group. [Page A1.]

title: Appeals Court Criticizes ExJudge Over Nepotism
description: Condemning nepotism and disguised nepotism among judges, the New York State Court of Appeals ordered yesterday the public admonition of a judge who had awarded court appointments to sons of other judges. Those judges, in turn, had given similar assignments to his son.

title: PARKING REGULATIONS
description: Because of trashremoval problems during the tugboat strike, alternateside parking regulations will be in effect today and tomorrow in Manhattan and Queens only.

title: Highlights of Pope's Reign.
description: Oct. 16, 1978  Karol Cardinal Wojtyla is elected Pope by the College of Cardinals as the 264th leader of the Roman Catholic Church. He selects the name John Paul II.

title: Obituary 5  No Title
description: Deaths

title: U.S. Officials Report Shift in Military Edge Toward Soviet Union
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  President Carter and his top national security aides have concluded that the military balance is shifting in favor of the Soviet Union and that the United States will have to increase its defense spending to stay even, Government officials said today.

title: Fluor Profit Up 75% in Quarter
description: The Fluor Corportion reported yesterday that net earnings for its fiscal second quarter ended April 30 rosa 75 percent, to $22.7 million, or $1.36 a share, from $13 million, or 77 cents a share, for the similar three months last year. Fluor is a builder of energy processing facilities overseas and also is involved domestically in general construction.

title: News of the Theater
description: EVERY Good Boy Deserves Favour, Tom Stoppard and Andr Previn's rarely performed theater piece about two men in a Soviet mental hospital, will have its New York premiere July 30 at the Metropolitan opera Hous. Ren Auberjonois and Eli Wallach will head the cast, with Mr. Auberjonois portraying an insane man who imagines himself the triangle player of a symphony orchestra and Mr. Wallach playing the role of a Soviet dissident. The play, which is performed with a symphony.. orchestra of about 100 on stage, will be here for eight perform. ances through Aug. 4 before moving to the Kennedy Center in Washington for a twoweek run.

title: Japan Buying Surge Cools Savings Rate
description: TOKYO, June 5  The Japanese, traditionally thrifty, are beginning to loosen their purse strings to spend more for leisure and amusement. me Government's statistics bureau has reported that consumer spending averaged $830 in February, 4.8 percent higher than a year earlier, after adjustment for inflation. It was the sharpest gain since a 4.3 percent rise in December 1975 and continued a trend that started in 1976 as inflation eased and wages rose.

title: The Region
description: HARTFORD  As of Oct. 1, motorists caught speeding on Connecticut highways will be forced to make a court appearance, pay higher fines and be subject to tighter rules, according to a bill passed by the State Senate..

title: WPIX Buys Challenger, Ending a 10Year Fight
description: A bitter and at times stormy 10year old contest for the license to operate Channel 11 in New York City ended yesterday with a settlement out of court. Under the settlement, the incumbent licensee, WPIX Inc., in effect purchased the stock of the challenging group, Forum Communications.

title: Conference Focus: Teenage Pregnancy
description: RACINE, Wis., June 5 (AP)  In a threeday conference here aimed at reducing the number of unwanted teenage pregnancies, about 50 professionals from organizations aiding young people emphasized the needs for dealing with sex education early and helping adolescents understand the difference between sexual relations and love.

title: Bronx Man Is Sentenced to Life For Attempting to Kill an Officer
description: A 21yearold Bronx man was sentenced to life in prison yesterday for the attempted murder of a police officer, who escaped death because a memo pad in his shirt pocket deflected a bullet.

title: Dow Advances 9.44 in Heavy Trading
description: A brisk rally sent stock prices ahead across a broad front yesterday as trading volume increased sharply. The Dow Jones industrial average advanced 9.44 points to 831.34. Posting another record, the American Stock Ex change's market value index added 1.04 to 190.29.

title: Schmidt Arrives for a 4Day Visit To Confer With Carter on Energy
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  Chancellor Helmut Schmidt of West Germany arrived here today for a fourday visit to consult with President Carter on oil and other energy problems and to discuss the new SovietAmerican arms treaty.

title: School District Fights Giving Test
description: School District 3 on Manhattan's West Side wants its 12,000 students excluded from the second citywide reading test scheduled today, but the city's School Chancellor, Frank J. Macchiarola, over. ruled the district yesterday and ordered that the test be given.

title: G.P.U. Reports Energy Accord
description: PARSIPPANY, N.J., June 5 (AP) The General Public Utilities Corpora tion announced today that it had reached an agreement with the Pennsylvania Power & Light Company of Allentown, Pa., fora lowercost supply of electricity to replace some of the energy that would have been provided by the Three Mile Island station.

title: Florio and Most Incumbents Win in Jersey's Primary
description: TRENTON, June 5  In today's primary elections across New Jersey, Representative James J. Florio won a gamble to strengthen his position within the Democratic Party as a contender for the governorship in 1981. Most incumbents in the State Assembly and candidates with organization backing had little trouble winning nominations for the general election in November.

title: Guidelines Appeal Is in Court June 13
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP) Acting with unusual speed, the United States Court of Appeals today set a June 13 date for hearing arguments in the Carter Administration's appeal of a lower court's ruling that bars the President from punishing violators of his wageprice guidelines.

title: Topics
description: There was a time when the outbreak of disease among people who refused modern medicine would have been branded a tragedy of stubbornness and superstition, a stupid waste, even a threat to society. But judging by the public response, including our own, to the Amish response to polio, we're no longer so sure.

title: Curb on Housing Bonds Advances in House Panel
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  At a contentious allday session, the House Ways and Means Committee today approved a series of measures to prevent states and cities from issuing tax-exempt bonds to finance housing for middle- and upperincome families.

title: Comex Volume Set Record in May
description: The Commodity Exchange Inc. said yesterday that total trading in May set a monthly record of 1,278,136 million contracts, representing more than $41 billion in metals futures contracts trading. The exchange, which is in New York, said the previous monthly record was established last January, when 1,221,988 contracts were traded.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS The Turkish Connection
description: LONDON You wish to know what the world needs now? What the world. needs now is linkage. Linkage between political concessions and political rewards; linkage between movement on the international and internal fronts.

title: Decision on Cambodia and Egypt Put Off at Parley
description: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka, June, 5  The 25member coordinating bureau of the third world nations meeting here, unable to agree on the explosive questions of representation for Cambodia and Egypt, decided today to pass th issues along to the foreign ministers opening a fourday conference here tomorrow.

title: 25 Million Saw TV Tony Show
description: Perhaps because they concern an essentially local industry  the Broadway theater  the Tony Awards telecasts have never attracted national audiences to compare with the Oscar and Emmy awards, and frequently the popularity ratings have fallen below the normal success standard in television. But the presentation of the Tonys on CBSTV Sunday night was one of the week's hits, drawing 32 percent of the audience in its time period and a total of 25 million viewers. The twohour telecast ranked 18th among the week's 62 primetime shows.

title: The Novice Canner's Guide
description: WASHINGTON

title: Ervin's Son Proposed for Bench
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  Sam J. Ervin 3d, son of former Senator Sam J. Ervin Jr., Democrat of North Carolina, was recommended today for appointment as a Federal appeals court judge by Senator Robert Morgan, who succeeded the elder Mr. Ervin in the Senate. The younger Mr. Ervin, 55 years old, has been a Superior Court judge in North Carolina since 1969. He lives in Morganton.

title: Gura of Royals Stops Yankees on 3 Hits, 31
description: Larry aura, a pitcher who passed up a better freeagent offer from the Yankees to return to Kansas City, discovered last night an antidote to his shaky pitching this season  an encounter with the Yankees.

title: Veterans and Feminists Clash on Hiring Decision
description: The United States Supreme Court's decision upholding a law that gives preference in public employment to veterans of the armed forces was, as expected, praised yesterday by veterans organizations and denounced by women's groups, who consider such laws a form of sex discrimination.

title: Du Pont, Listing Deficits, Will End Dye Operations
description: E.I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, the nation's largest chemical producer, announced yesterday at its headquarters in Wilmington, Del., that it was quitting the dye business after five years of unprofitable operations.

title: Soviet Gives a Warning On Issue of West Berlin
description: WEST BERLIN, May 5  The Soviet Union warned today of possible trouble for West Berlin if its delegates participated in the European Parliament being elected during the next week.

title: Levy's Jewish Rye Will Soon Be Arnold's
description: YOU don't have to be Jewish to mourn a bit over the passing of Levy's Real Jewish Rye Bread from Brooklyn, after 91 years, to Connecticut.

title: Economic Scene
description: THE Iranian revolution has again exposed the utter vulnerability of the United States to inter- ruptions in oil supply. The rapid runup in prices resulting from the subtraction of a couple of million barrels a day has still not run its course. bauai Arabia, me reucrant aragon, nas now announced that it regretfully is raising the price of its Berrifield crude to $17.87 a barrel as a means achieving stability in world oil prices before the June 26 meeting of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries. And Iran itself has raised the price of its crude again.

title: S.E.C. Acts to Encourage Forecasting of Earnings
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  The Securities and Exchange Commission approved in principle today a rule intended to encourage companies to make earnings forecasts by protecting them against fraud charges in case their forecasts do not come true.

title: Stage: Privates Parade, Peter Nichols s Comedy
description: NEW HAVEN, June 5  In his best plays, Joe Egg and ForgetMeNot Lane, Peter Nichols combines a sardonic sense of comedy with a deep concern tor me individual spirit. Although these plays are definably British in atmosphere and character, they achieve a universality. In contrast, Mr. Nichols's most recent play, Privates on Parade, seen in London last year in the Royal Shakespeare Company production, seemed too English for export. A broad burlesque comedy with music about a postWorld War II special service unit in Malaysia, it struck a responsive chord among the English. To ; a visiting American, it seemed a sporadically amusing but rather insular experience.

title: Ten Good Years for Columbia
description: William McGill became president of Columbia University in 1970 just as the institution was emerging from a disruptive, indeed traumatic decade. After an even longer period of inadequate leadership, the university's fiscal foundations had been dangerously weakened; the rebellions of the Sixties had impaired its academic performance and reputation; and New York City's troubles had radically altered the surrounding Morningside Heights community. When Dr. McGill steps down a year from now, he will leave a campus that is academically confident and financially stabilized, a monument to ten years of tough yet sensitive reconstruction.

title: WASHINGTON Carter, Alone in Vienna
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 President Carter has decided not to invite any senators to join him at the summit meeting with President Brezhnev for the signing of the strategic arms limitation treaty in Vienna later this month.

title: Bankers Trust to Sell Units Piecemeal
description: The Bankers Trust Company, in a shift in strategy, is discussing the sale of its 89 branches in the New York metropolitan area to a number of other banks based in New York State as part of a plan to deemphasize retail banking, or dealing with consumers, according to industry sources.

title: Liberties Group Urges Retaining Of Mastropieri
description: The New York Civil Liberties Union urged the City Council yesterday not to expel Councilman Eugene F. Mastropieri, saying that the offenses he is accused of were not sufficient justification to overturn the decision of his constituents who elected him.

title: Mazzei to Supervise Cosmos New Coach
description: Less than a week after the Cosmos dismissed Eddie Firmani as coach and made Ray Klivecka his interim replacement, the team's board of directors named Prof. Julio Mazzei as interim technical director yesterday, with duties that include supervising Klivecka.

title: Uniroyal Charged With Bad Faith
description: AKRON, Ohio, June 5  Peter C. Bornmarito, president of the United Rubber Workers, today angrily denounced Uniroyal Inc.'s latest contract offer and charged the company with bargaining in bad faith.

title: FixedIncome Issues Strengthen
description: The primary market for fixedincome securities showed unexpected strength yesterday. More than $3.7 billion of Federal agency, corporate and taxexempt notes and bonds were orfered for sale, and most of them were reported to be placed with investors increasingly convinced that a weakening economy would mean lower interest rates ahead.

title: Sadat Reports Accord With China for Arms And New Bid to U.S.
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  President Anwar elSadat announced today that Egypt had concluded an arms deal with China and that he would ask the United States for licenses to produce the most modem weapons.

title: Senate Votes to Let Carter Set State Energy Targets
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Senate voted tonight to give President Carter authority to set energy conservation tareets for each of the 50 states. The plan, approved by 77 to 13 and sent to the House of Representatives,. would allow the President to impose mandatory measures on any state that failed to implement a plan to meet the targets he sets.

title: Carey in Deal On Drug Bill
description: ALBANY, June 5  Governor Carey made an offer today to. the Senate's Democratic minority to keep it from scuttling an agreement between the majorities of the two houses to end some of the mandatory life sentences and reduce some of the penalties for firsttime offenders under the socalled Rockefeller Drug Laws.

title: Asia Society Building Rising on Park Ave.
description: THE Aia Society, which has been housed since 1959 in a sleek glass townhouse on East 64th Street, broke ground yesterday at the noitheast corner of Park

title: Bird's Lawyer and Celtics Confer on Star's Contract
description: Red Auerbach, president and general manager of the Boston Celtics, made another attempt yesterday to sign Larry Bird, the college player of the year.

title: Notes on People
description: Out of the Tony Awards presentations comes a footnote about Henry Fonda, who was genuinely surprised by the special award he received. More than a few people watching the show have wondered how he could not have known what was up, especially with his daughter, Jane, on hand.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: URING a visit to London last fall, Sybil April and her husband were on their way back to their hotel when they spied a large crowd and realized that it had gathered to watch the filming of a movie. which turned out to he Ike

title: Deaths
description: RABINSylvia beloved wife of Irv ing, devoted mother of Tessa Kean and Barbara Gray. loving daughter of Beatrice Sunshine, dear sister of Lillian Lipman adored grandmother. Services were held Tuesday June 5th.

title: KANSAS CITY ARENA LOSES R00F IN STORM
description: KANSAS CITY, Mo., Tune 5 The roof of Kemper Arena,, the awardwinning building selected by the Republican Party for its 1976 national convention, collapsed last night in heavy rain and high winds. The arena was empty except for maintenance and security personnel, and there were no injuries.

title: With the Gas Shortage, Lamps Flickering Out
description: WASHINGTON Americans bade ,farewell to the village lamplighter so long ago that few remember ever ,Seeing one on the job. Now his last legacy, the flickering gas lamps seen illuminating historic districts in old cities, the paths to ersatz Colonial houses in the suburbs and the exteriors of country inns, are marked for extinction as well.

title: End the Unfair Underwriting of Nuclear Power
description: WASHINGTON  The rapid expansion of commercial nuclear energy in the United States is largely attributable to a 1957 piece of legislation known as the PriceAnderson Act.

title: Feeding 4,800: More Than a Job, It's a Shipboard Adventure
description: ABOARD U.S.S. INDEPENDENCE The odors aboard ship are overwhelming. Engine steam and airplane grease mingle uncomfortably with disinfectant and hang heavily in the sardinecan corridors of the Indy. But slowly, another smell triumphs freshly baked doughnuts begin to permeate part of the ship.

title: Companies List Earnings
description: For periods as shown. (N) indicates stock is listed an the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: U.SCanadian Tar Oil Pact
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (Reuters) The United States and Canada signed an agreement today to try to develop the vast oil resources locked in the tar sands of western Canada and the northwest United States. The tar sands of Alberta and Saskatchewan in Canada and Montana and Utah in the United States are estimated to contain more than the entire oil reserves of Saudi Arabia.

title: Article 1 -- No Title
description: HOUSTON MEN FREED BY COLOMBIA: Roy McLemore, left, and William A. Spradley in Miami after being freed by authorities in Colombia, where they had been arrested and fined for violating that country's air space. The men were seized after landing their plane in an area used heavily by drug smugglers, but denied any Involvement in smugglnig. They were met in Miami by a lawyer, and refused to make any statement before flying on to Houston.

title: Personal Health
description: AMERICANS spend fortunes trying to ward off the ravages of age with such surface improvements as makeup, hair dyes, toupees, face lifts and smart clothes. But once again it turns out, as that old 20's tune put it, the best things in life are free.

title: Tito Ends Visit to Malta
description: VALLETTA, Malta, June 5 (Reuters)  President Tito of Yugoslavia left for home today after a threeday visit to Malta as part of a threenation tour during which he also met the leaders of Libya and Algeria.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: AMF Inc., a producer of leisuretime and industrial products, has elected to its board of directors David W. Mitchell, chairman and chief executive officer of Avon Products Inc., and William H. Bricker, president and chief executive officer of the Diamond Shamrock Corporation. .

title: Tarkenton Is a Fan Again
description: Red Smith

title: Martin, Yankees Talk
description: After many, many months, George Steinbrenner and Billy Martin finally have held a closeddoor, facetoface meeting, but the Yankee owner still refuses to say unequivocally that Martin will manage the Yankees next season.

title: Art: Cleveland Museum Shows Work of Chardin
description: CLEVELAND, June 5  He was not the most inventive of artists, and his subjects were rather humdrum: dead game, kitchen pots and solid bourgeois citizens. Yet the French painter Jean Simon Chardin (1699.1779) was beloved by the dazzling 18th century, which cherished his very artlessness. He catches nature in the act, wrote the Abb JeanBernard Le Blanc in 1753, and other contemporary critics spoke of his simplicity, his truth to life and his spirituality.

title: Tenneco Discovers Oil Off Jersey
description: Tenneco Inc. announced yesterday that it had found oil and more natural gas at an underwater well off New Jersey where it recently encountered some gas. But the company said that its finds were not sufficient to justify commercial development of the lease.

title: LEE LUNZER
description: Lee Lunzer, a Pragueborn artist who worked for major American magazines and department stores, died last Sunday in St. Elizabeth Hospital. She lived at 350 Cabrini Boulevard.

title: Ecuador Raises Oil Prices 32%
description: QUITO, Ecuador, June 5 (UPI) Ecuador's statecontrolled petroleum company raised its oil prices by 32 percent today, from $20.36 a barrel to $26.80.

title: Sports Today
description: BASEBALL

title: News Summary
description: The Pope appealed to Poland's regime to recognize the cause of fundamental human lights, including the right to religious liberty. Pope John Paul II made the plea during an address before 78 Polish bishops. He urged them to seek a broad discussion with the Communist Government aimed at achieving normalization of churchstate relations. [Page Al, Columns 34.]

title: Excerpts From Opinions in Court's RulingUpholding Veterans' Job Preference
description: WASHINGTON, June 5Following are excerpts from the text of the majority opinion by Associate Justice Potter Stewart and the minority opinion by Associate Justice Thurgood Marshall in the Supreme Court ruling today upholding a Massachusetts law granting veterans absolute preference in Civil Service appointments against charges that the system constituted discrimination based on sex.

title: HIGH COURT UPHOLDS A CIVIl SERVICE EDGE FOR WARS VETERANS
description: WASHINGTON, June 5The Supreme Court ruled today that a state can hire veterans in preference to nonveterans without unconstitutiorrally discriminating against women, even though the policy may overwhelmingly benefit men and have a devastating impact on women's Civil Service job opportunities.

title: Italian Communists Again Ask Role in Government
description: ROME, June 5  The Communist Party today restated its demand for full participation in a new government as Italy's political parties squared off for negotiations on the formation of a cabinet.

title: Pam Shriver Wins Twice In Beckenham Tennis
description: BECKENHAM, England, June (AP)  Pam Shriver won her first two matches as a fulltime plaver in a grass court tournament tody. The 16-earold, who graduated from high school in Lutherville, Md., last week, beat 22yearold Kim Sands of Miami, 62, 75, in her firstround match. She then advanced to the third round by defeating Nancy Yeargin of Greenville, S.C., 64, 64.

title: FouirYear Term in Beating Death
description: A 32yearold resident of a Bronx boarding house, Melvin Cureton, was sentenced to four years in prison yesterday for the beating deathof a fellow resident of the boarding house. District Attorney Mario Merola said Mr. Cureton got into fight with Timothy Jefferson outside the home at 1119 Boston Road last August and. that Mr. Jefferson tried to hit Mr. Cureton with a nightstick he was carrying. According to authorities, Mr. Cureton took the nightstick away and began beating Mr. Jefferson, who died several hours after the fight.

title: Obituary 4  No Title
description: Deaths

title: Burke, Quigley Qualify
description: GREENWICH, Conn., June 5 When the thunder and lightning struck and the rain started to fall at the Stanwich Club today, Michael Burke Jr. already was in the clubhouse with the best score of the day, a twotnlerpar 146, in the 36hole sectional qualifying for the United States Open.

title: Quasar Image Split by Gravity Is Reported
description: Astronomers have detected a quasar near the fringes of the observable universe whose image they suspect has been split by the gravity of an extremely massive object roughly midway between the quasar and the Earth.

title: Reds Beat Mets, 61; Hebner Hurts Back
description: CINCINNATI, June 5  On the days when Craig Swan and Pat Zachry pitch, we have a good shot, said Joe Tone, the juggler of the New York Mets' pitching staff. But for three days in between the two top guys, we improvise.

title: Legislators Pay New Attention To Ethnic Voter
description: ALBANY, June 5  In the old ItalianQmerican neighborhoods, Vote the vowel meant casting a ballot for one of your own. But ItalianAmericans are not looking for the vowel enough any more, according to some scholars. and politicians who gathered here today under the aegis of the ItalianAmerican Leislatrs Club.

title: Archbishop of Canterbury to Quit
description: LONDON, June 5  Dr. Donald Cog. gan, Archbishop of Canterbury and primate of the Church of England, announced today that he would resign in January.

title: Freighter Burns on Lake Superior
description: COPPER HARBOR, Mich., June (AP)  A Great Lakes freighter burned like a bonfire today, killing four men and injuring five others. Two of the 25 crew memners, all Canadians, were missing after the fire, which drove 19 of the crewmen overboard into the frigid waters of Lake Superior.

title: Deaths
description: FERBERMilton, Vice President, Miller and Veit Inc., passed away after a short illness. All employees wish to convey condolences to the Ferber family.

title: White Holds Kennedy Must Bar Own Race if President Is to Win
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  John C. White, chairman of the Democratic National, Committee, today expressed frustration at his party's invisible primary and said that at some point Senator Edward M. Kennedy would have to make categorical statement taking himself out of the 1980 Presidential race to enable President Carter to be reelected.

title: Leaders of Israel Attend Funera: Of Dora Bloch, Victim of Idi Amin
description: JERUSALEM, June 5  President Yitzhak Navon and other public figures attended the state funeral here this afternoon of Dora Bloch, who was murdered on orders from former President Idi Amin, the deposed dictator of Uganda, after a raid by Israeli forces had freed the other hostages of a hijacked airliner at the Entebbe airport in July 1976.

title: Bridge:
description: If you bid to an aggressive slam contract in a 52 trump fit, missing Q1087, you would normally have to hope for a good trump break. You would not fancy your chances if you were told that all six missing trumps were bunched in one hand, but you should not give up hope.

title: U.S. Judge Bids F.A.A. Ground DC10 Airliners
description: A Federal judge in Washington ordered the grounding of the country's 138 DC10 jumbo jets yesterday until the cause of the jetliner crash last month In Chicago has been found;but several hours later granted a stay pending a new hearing on the issue today.

title: Consent Accord For Korvette's
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Korvette's Inc., the discount department store that operates in more than 50 stores in six cities and the District of Columbia, has settled a complaint by the Federal Trade Commission by agreeing to provide its customers with adequate notice of available warranties on products prior to their sale.

title: Other Ivies Also Proud of 54
description: AT two other Ivy League schools, reunions are also lavish and, as a quick check suggested, the major reunion classes are also well stocked with graduates who have done well.

title: France Suspends the Drug Trial Of Heiress to Opel Auto Fortune
description: DRAGUIGNAN, France, June 5 (Reuters) - The trial of MarieChristina von Opel, the auto heiress arrested on drug charges, was suspended here today so that additional evidence could be obtained from a West German jailed in connection with the case.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Tuesday, June 5, 1979

title: SHARP DROP IS FOUND IN HIGHWAY TRAVEL
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 The Department of Transportation confirmed today that highway travel in the United States was declining for the first time in decades, mostly because of widely reported gasoline shortages. spot trends at various points around the country, including rural and city settings, showed some dramatic declines that sent travelers scurrying for various modes of public transportation in record numbers.

title: Bill on Bank Reserves at Fed Gains
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  A bill aimed at stopping the exodus of banks from the Federal Reserve System won approval today from the House Banking Committee

title: McGuire Names Two New Aides In a Reorganization of Legal Unit
description: The appointment of two new assistan commissioners was announced yesterdai by the Police Commissioner, Robert J McGuire, as part of a reorganization o the department's legal services.

title: Wine Talk
description: IN February, on Washington's Birthday, the California Wine Institute, in conjunction with a commercial wine club called Les Amis du Vin, held a wine tasting at the United States Embassy in Paris.

title: Nepotism in History: Footnote by the Court
description: Nepotism was a custom in the Han dynasty (4 Encyclopedia Britannica, 310b) and often respected in the philosophies of the Middle East as reflecting a praiseworthy sense of family loyalty (16 Collier's Encyclopedia, 162 d). In the western world, however, where it came to prominence as a practice of papal authority commencing with Pope Adrian I in the eighth century and reached its zenith during the Renaissance, it was repeatedly condemned (e.g. Dante, Inferno, 19.31, 19.5281, 27.85.129; Petrarch, Epistulae sine nomine 11, ed. P. Piur, Petrarcas Buch ohne Namen and die ppstliche Kurie [Halle 1925]; G. H. Hist. Cardinals II. I.116 (1670)  Ministers that buy the favour of the Nepotisme, do revive..a new Neronisme of Tyranny.) The Church itself ultimately took steps to impede it through papal bull (Pope Pius V, Admonet nos [1567]) and constitution (Roman= decet pontificem [1692]). More generally, it has been regarded as a form of misuse of authority, associated with corruption (11 International Encyclopedia of Social Sciences, 275).

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Irvine H. Sprague, chairman of the Federal agency that insures savings accounts, does not have a savings account himself. But apparently Mr. Sprague can give a good account of himself at the track.

title: Koosman Ambles Down Memory Lane
description: BALTIMORE, June 5  Jerry Koosman remembers the first time. It was in 1966. He was 22 years old, a pitcher for the Auburn Meta, and they played an exhibition game against the Binghamton Yankees at Yankee Stadium. On the way, they stopped at Shea Stadium to pick up their Met uniforms, and he walked into the clubhouse for the first time.

title: Carters to Honor Black Music Month
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  Black music will be celebrated at the White House tomorrow evening at a buffet supper on the South Lawn with President and Mrs. Carter as hosts. There also will be an hourlong concert by black musicians, including the gospel singers Sarah Jordan Powell and Andres Crouch; the Jazz singer Billy Eck stine; the disco singer Evelyn (Champagne) King and Chuck Berry.

title: Pope Calls on Polish Government For Guarantee of Religious Liberty
description: CZESTOCHOWA, Poland, June 5 Pope John Paul II today called on Poland's Communist Government to recognize the cause of fundamental human rights, including the right to religious liberty, and urged his bishops to seek a discussion with the Government aimed at achieving a normalization of relations between church and state.

title: Hess's to Open New Store
description: Philip I. Berman, chairman of Hess's Inc., a department store chain, said yesterday that negotiations had been completed to open a new store, to be called Hess's Lebanon, In the Lebanon Plaza Mall in North Cornwall Township, outside of Lebanon, Pa. The store is expected to open next spring.

title: 110 on Strike at Greek Airline
description: ATHENS, June 5 (AP)  Half of Olympic Airways international flights were grounded by a 48hour strike begun today by the Greek airline's flight engineers, a company spokesman said. All domestic flights were being conducted normally,. he said, since 18 of the 128 engineers were not participating in the walkout.

title: Court Holds Congressmen Liable to Suits for Sex Bias
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  The Supreme Court ruled today, 5 to 4, that even though Congress specifically exempted its members when it outlawed discrimination in employment, the Constitution gives a Congressional employee the direct right to sue a Congressman for damages on the grounds of race or sex discrimination.

title: Guide GOING OUT
description: PEOPLE'S CHOICE Who? The Muppets, of course, and the First Ragamuffin Family of television is here today in a free exhibition at Lincoln Center LibraryMuseum focusing on the life, times and creation of the beloved tribe of entertainers for all ages. What many fans perhaps forget is that the Muppets, named for a combination of marionette and puppet, were created by Jim Henson 23 years ago.

title: Coastal's Belmont Status Is Undecided
description: Running him against Spectacular Bid, says William Haggin Perry, the owner of Coastal, might be kind of foolish.

title: Q&A
description: Q. Some fish recipes call for lacing the top of fish with salt pork or bacon before baking. Is there a substitute for vegetarians?

title: Europe Is Cool To Its Election
description: PARIS, June 5  Just days before the European Community's first direct election, voters throughout the area are showing apathy and confusion when it comes to their Opportunity to participate Politically in the Common Market.

title: Agency Bids Carter Drive Explain Funds Owed Rafshoon Ad Group
description: WASHINGTON, June 5  The Federal Election Commission has questioned why the committee that ran Jimmy Carter's 1976 Presidential campaign did not disclose, once the election was over, that it still owed $134,482.85 to the agency that handled the committee's advertising. The question apparently has been referred to the commission's general counsel.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: The Standard OIl Company (Ohio) announced yesterday that it had agreed. to acquire for a total of about $94 million Webb Resources Inc. and the Newco Exploration Company, two Denverbased companies that have substantial holdings of oil and gas exploration acreage in the Rocky Mountain states.

title: Obituary 2  No Title
description: BENJAMIN SIGEL

title: For Creation of a Department of Education
description: WASHINGTONThe Senate recently voted 7221 to shift a large number of existing Federal education programs into a separate Cabinet department. The House of Representatives is expected to vote on this reorganization in the next several days.

title: Byrne to Pay Florida Costs
description: TRENTON, June 5  Governor Byrne said today that he would pay the cost of air travel, rooms and meals for his wife and two children who accompanied him to a Florida convention last month to avoid even the appearance of a conflict.

title: Private Lives
description: SOMEONE on the telephone wants to know what he dreams about. A magazine, of course, is doing an article: New York's 10 Worst Dreamers, maybe. The avidity of the public for prurient details is amazing. They climb into our heads and beds. Tell us about your digestive tract. How has your bile duct been the last six months? Itemize your failures of character. If we let it all hang out, won't it get cold or stolen?

title: The City Rent Agency Rejects Members Criticism
description: Responding to criticism made Monday by four members of the New York State Temporary Commission on Rental Housing, Jacob B. Ward, chairman of the commission, called the criticism misleading and inaccurate and flawed in many ways. Mr. Ward said the commission was making substantial progress toward issuing recommendations to the Legislature on housing policies and rent laws.

title: Carlton Allows 1 Hit As Phils Rout Astros
description: HOUSTON, June 5 (UPI)  Steve Carlton, allowing only a seventhinning single to Jeff Leonard, pitched his fourth career onehitter, and Pete Rose paced a 17hit attack with three singles tonight as the Philadelphia Phillies snapped the Houston Astros sevengame winning streak with an 80 triumph.

title: Clark Says He Will Shift. Embassy to Jerusalem
description: OTTAWA, June 5 (Reuters)  Canada's new Prime Minister, Joe Clark, confirmed today that the Canadian Embassy in Israel would be moved from Tel Aviv to Jerusalem.

title: Banker Is Held in Premature Sale Of New Susan B. Anthony Coins
description: DETROIT, June 5  Although it was not to be released until early in July, the Susan B. Anthony coin has been appearing in several cities lately, to the dismay of Federal officials, and Richard Papciak, a vice president of the Michigan National Bank here, was arrested yesterday and charged with misapplying about 1,155 onedollar coins bearing the likeness of the pioneer in women's suffrage.

title: Organist: Miss Crozier
description: ORGANS do not lend themselves to being tucked under the perforrner'sarm, like the violin, or loaded into a truck, like the piano. Except for certain transistorized and miniaturized contraptions that have virtually nothing in common with the king of instruments but the name, great organs are not portable. If you want to hear a famous organ, you must go where it lives, which is usually in a church. As a result, organ virtuosos find it difficult to establish themselves with the wide musical public, which tends to worship its gods in concert halls.

title: Can We Afford No Nukes?
description: Even before the Three Mile Island investigations are finished, pressures are rising to ban, or suspend, nuclear power. Moratoriums have been proposed Congress and last weekend thousands of demonstrators picketed nuclear sites around the world, bearing signs calling for No Nukes. Some people want to ban any new nuclear plants. Others would halt plants already in construction. Still others would abandon those now in service. Is there a sensible interim answer?

title: 2 Get White House Press Jobs
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (UPI)  President Carter's press secretary, Jody Powell, announced today that Patricia Bario had been named to succeed Walt Wurfel as deputy White House press secretary and director of the media liaison office. She had been Mr. Wurfel's deputy. Mr. Powell also announced that Jim Perks, a former correspondent for The Associated Press, had been named assistant press secretary.

title: Mets Draft Leary
description: Baseball held its semiannual freeagent draft yesterday and, after trouble with the telephones in the commissioner's Rockefeller Center office, the Mets selected a pitcher named Timothy Leary, and the Yankees apparently got a wrong number when they chose the son of Don Demeter, the outfielder who drove in 107 runs for the 1962 Philadelphia Phillies.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Six Favorites From the Shops
description: NO longer just a wayside market for vitamins, herb teas and curious grains, health food stores have become an excellent source for highquality specialty items, generally unavailable in other markets. Most are expensive but worth the price.

title: Former U.C.L.A. Coach Takes Oregon College Job
description: MONMOUTH, Ore., June 5 (AP) Gary Cunningham, who stepped down as U.C.L.A. basketball coach three months ago, was named today as athletic director and director of the health and physical education department at Oregon College of Education.

title: Best Buys
description: FOOD shoppers are finally experiencing slight relief from soaring prices. Last week, average prices for pork chops and bottpm round dropped substantially, heiju ng$ reduce the weekly market basket by $1.10.

title: More Secrets Indicated In South Africa Scandal
description: JOHANNESBURG, June 5 (Reuters)  Cornelius P. Mulder, the Cabinet minister forced to resign last year in South Africa's Information Ministry scandal, said today that the full truth had yet to emerge about the misuse of Government funds that also led to the resignation of John Vorster as President.

title: Change in Disability Aid Blocked by House Pane
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  In a surprise move today, the House Rules Committee blocked a bill that would restrict Social Security disability insurance benefits and add new work incentives to the program.

title: Deadline Passes for Koch Budget With Officials $1,5 Million Apart
description: Enmeshed in a political dispute over police hiring, city officials let a midnight deadline go by without adopting an expense budget for the 1980 fiscal year, which begins July 1.

title: Radio
description: Music

title: Loews Goal Is Stake in Woolworth
description: The F. W. Woolworth Company, which only a week ago emerged from the shadow of a takeover bid by Brascan Ltd., a Canadian holding company, said yesterday that the Loews Corporation had disclosed plans to acquire major stake in the retailing chain.

title: Rail Rates Rise 1.2% on Freight
description: WASHINGTON, June 5 (AP)  The Interstate Commerce Commission last night granted the nation's railroads a 1.2 percent increase in their freight rates, effective today.

title: Vilas, Gerulaitis Gain in Tennis
description: PARIS, June 5  Bjorn Borg and Vitas Gerulaitis advanced to the semifinals of the French open tennis tournament today, but Gene Mayer failed in his bid to upset thirdseeded Guillermo Vilas.

title: 10Day Car Sales Plunge 20.2%
description: DETROIT, June 5 Sales of passenger cars made by Detroit's Big Three producers plunged 20.2 percent in the final third of May. The decline, for the sixth consecutive 10day selling period, was attributed by industry analysts to anxiety over gasoline supplies and eroding consumer confidence in the economy.

title: EnergySaving Plan Offered
description: The American Express Company said yesterday that it was introducing nationwide service to help cut the enemy costs of the 33.000 restaurants. that use its credit card. About 950 restaurants, mostly in New York, New Jersey and California, have already asked for the service, American Express said.

title: 200th English Derby Disappoints Royalty
description: EPSOM, England, June 6  The fairy tale of the 200th English Derby ended a quarter of a mile short here today when Queen Elizabeth's colt, Milford, was overtaken by Troy, ridden by the Queen's jockey, who went on to win the $306,000 first prize by seven lengths.

title: Miss Van Norden Bride of Executive
description: Kristina Van Norden, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Montagnie Van Norden of New York, was married yesterday afternoon to John Andrew Anderson, son of Mr. and Mrs. George William Anderson of Kenosha, Wis. The Rev. Andrew J. W. Mullins performed the ceremony in St. Bartholomew's Episcopal Church.

title: Peking Honors Mao's Second Wife, Long in Eclipse
description: HONG KONG, June 6 Mao Zedong's second wife, who had not been publicly mentioned since he divorced her in the late 1930's, has been made a member of the Chinese People's Political Consultative Conference.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Federated Department Stores Inc.,  a Cincinnatibased department store chain, has elected Jack L. Ratzkin a senior vice president and general counsel and Bruce MacLeod vice presidentreal estate.

title: Notes on People
description: Twentyfive years ago a divinity student named Andrew Young married Jean Childs, a juniorcollege instructor, and they thought it was such a good Idea that they did it again at the WaldorfAstoria the other day. Actually their anniversary is not until today, but with family and old friends around from Mr. Young's days as a civilrights activist, the United States delegate to the United Nations and his wife decided not to wait for the renewal of their vows.

title: The U.N. Today
description: ECONOMIC AND SOCIAL COUNCIL

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesterday's Weather at 1 P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/UPI

title: Music: Philharmonic
description: LEONARD BERNSTEIN, at 60, is surely America's bestknown living musician both here and abroad and, quite possibly, still the most dynamic. The prodigious energies that have been poured into conducting thousands of concerts, composing Broadway musicals, symphonic works and other big pieces, writing and appearing in awardwinning television programs, teaching, lecturing and goodness knows what else are apparently flowing as freely as ever.

title: Digging Up House Roots
description: RIDGEFIELD, CONN.

title: Q&A
description: Q. The paint on the galvanized gutters on my house keeps peeling. Last year I scraped off all the flaking sections and treated the exposed metal with a primer made for galvanized metal, then covered this with a latex paint. This spring the peeling is worse than ever. Is this because the gutters have sagged in a few places under heavy snow?  G.J.C. Depew, N.Y.

title: Bonn Reserves Rise
description: FRANKFURT, June 6 (AP)  Net monetary reserves of West German's central bank rose by $1.25 billion to $41.9 billion in the week ended May 31. the bank reported in its weekly statement today. It said the rise was a result of transactions with domestic banks involving dollar purchases as part of an effort to increase German bank liquidity.

title: Bank Weighing Branch Purchases
description: The National Bank of North America said yesterday that it was actively considering purchasing a number of metropolitan area branches of the Bankers Trust Company.

title: Voters in Coast County Ban Spraying of Herbicide
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 6  Voters in rural Mendocino County in northwestern California approved an initiative yesterday to ban the aerial spraying of phenoxy herbicides.

title: BUSINESS Digest
description: Washington

title: RKO Creates Radio Network
description: RKO Radio, a unit of RKO General Inc., said yesterday that it had formed a new radio broadcasting network that would carry 60 taped feature programs weekly. Operation of the network is to start next Feb. 1 with Thomas Burchill as vice president and general manager.

title: 2 More in Crew May Be Missing
description: COPPER HARBOR, Mich., June 6 (UPI)  The Canadian freighter Cartiercliffe Hall, ravaged by a flash fire in which at least four crewmen were killed and five others injured, was towed today to Thunder Bay, Ontario.

title: Landscaper Weds Art To Nature
description: THE skills of an artist, the knowledge of a botanist and keen ears for music are combined in the extraordinary talents of the Brazilian landscape architect, Roberto Burle Marx. He is equally at nome when painting murals or designing a garden and he has had a great influence on the changing attitudes in landscape design.

title: CORRECTIONS
description: Because of a technical error, an arilcle in The Times yesterday about the collapse of the roof of Kemper Arena in Kansas City, Mo., omitted part of a remark byEhrman B. Mitchell Jr., president of the American Institute of Architects. Mr. Mitchell said of the accident: There is doubt and worry. It's sort of like the DC10  people wonder how designers could do such a thing. But I don't think the problems last. People understand that these are accidents beyond our control ; they will not say that I won't go into buildings like that from now on.'

title: Texans Held in Colombia Arrive In Houston to Face a Grand Jury
description: HOUSTON, June 6 (UPI)  Two Texans who were held in Colombia for a month on suspicion of marijuana smuggling returned home early today, withholding comment pending grand jury appearances.

title: Business Records
description: BANKRUPTCY PROCEEDINGS SOUTHERN DISTRICT Wednesday, June 6, 1979

title: ABROAD AT HOME
description: WASHINGTON  Political acts sometimes send devastating symbolic messages. So it was when the Israeli Cabinet this week approved a plan by the Gush Emunim, the Jewish zealots who say they have a right to settle anywhere in the Biblical Land of Israel, to build a settlement near Nablus in the West Bank.

title: Jersey Bank Merger Fought
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (Reuters) The Justice Department filed a civil antitrust suit today to block the proposed merger of two commercial banks in New Jersey.

title: 450 Taxicab Drivers Strike in Philadelphia
description: PHILADELPHIA, June 6 (AP)  At least 450 of the city's 850 Yellow Cab drivers were off the job today, the same day a site selection committee for the 1980 Democratic national convention arrived.

title: Minor Blaze Hits Gracie Mansion
description: A fire broke out last night in an electrical outlet on the rear terrace of Gracie Mansion, Mayor Koch's official residence, but it was confined to a small area and damage was said to be light.

title: U.S.Turkey Prisoner Pact Is Set
description: WASHINGTON, June 6 (UPI)  The United States and Turkey will sign a prisonerexchange agreement in Ankara tomorrow, the State !Department announced today. When ratified by both countries, in about three months, the agreement will clear the way for four Americans and nine Turks to serve out their jail terms in their own countries.

title: Egypt Elects Parliament Today In First Multiparty Vote Since 52
