description: LANCASTER, Pa.  The national press has picked up the tragic story of an outbreak of polio in Pennsylvania among =immunized people. Because six of the eight known cases have been among members of the Old Order Amish, a great deal is being broadcast and written about the Amish these days. Much of this reporting is misleading. Some of it is sadly insensitive and unfair.

title: Topics
description: The City Club of New York got down to the nittygritty, so to speak, of urban esthetics this week. Among its prestigious annual Bard Awards for Excellence in Architecture and Urban Design was a special citation for the Canine Waste Law. The quality of life, the jurors noted, is defined by a variety of factors, both large and small. New York has become a more enjoyable place to walk, they reported. Pedestrians can now look up and appreciate the buildings.

title: Workmen Prepare Lunar Landing Module for Anniversary
description: Outside the United Nations yesterday, workmen and technicians pushed a scale model of the lunar module, Eagle, into position in preparation for commemorative dedication Friday. July 20 will mark the 10th anniversary of the first manned landing on the moon by Neil A. Armstrong and Col. Edwin E. Aldrin Jr., and the historic first words from the lunar surface: Tranquility Base here. The Eagle has landed, and the reply from the Houston Space Center, Roger, Tranquility, we copy you on the ground. You've got a bunch of guys about to turn blue.

title: CREDIT MARKETS 2Year 9.22% Note Yield Is Lowest Since October
description: The Treasury sold twoyear notes yesterday at an average yield of 9.22 percent, the lowest interest rate on such securities since last October.

title: Kaiser Is Critical of TV For Rejecting Issue Ads
description: The Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation criticized the three major television networks yesterday for rejecting a group of issueoriented commercials that the company wished to air.

title: Events
description: BURIED CHILD by Sam Shepard; directed by Robert Woodruff, Circle Repertory, 99 Seventh Avenue South, B.

title: Television
description: 5:55(4)Childrenand All That Jazz

title: Tales Told, Grief Recalled In the Shade of a Family Tree
description: FLORENCE, ALA. TWO sisters born before the automobile, Maude Hale and Pearl Hale, grow up quite poor and marry men of their own station. Maude marries a Trousdale; Pearl becomes a Romine. They both have many babies, and it ages them so. In the 1950's, not too many years apart, Maude and Pearl are lowered into the Alabama earth before a sad kindred, some of whom will soon split to the corners of America in search of better jobs.

title: Too Tall to Enter Ring
description: Ed (Too Tall) Jones, the 6foot9inch, 270pound allpro defensive end for the Dallas Cowboys, has decided not to rush the passer next year. Instead, he will pursue a career as a boxer.

title: 3 Die in Yugoslav Train Plunge
description: BELGRADE, Yugoslavia, June 19 (UPI)  A freight train in Montenegro jumped the tracks last night, sending three locomotives and more than 30 cars into a ravine near Titograd. Railway officials said three engineers were killed.

title: One Killed in Panama During Riot Protesting Increase in Gas Prices
description: PANAMA CITY, June 19 (AP)  National Guard troops firing shotguns and tear gas chased antiGovernment rioters into the United Statescontrolled Canal Zone today, quelling violence in which one man was killed and another seriously injured.

title: Swimming: Where to Learn
description: The Y.M.C.A. and the American Red Cross operate yearround swimming instructional programs in the metropolitan area.

title: Corporate Bonds Are Very Active
description: A large volume of speculative corporate bonds was marketed yesterday, and most of the securities  yielding from 11 to 13 percent  apparently were snapped up by investors soon after they were offered for sale.

title: 68 Fires Gain in Ontario Woods; One Spreads on an 8Mile Front
description: THUNDER BAY, Ontario, June 19 (UPI)  Seven new blazes, one covering 11,000 acres, were repoited today, bringing to 68 the total in rich woodland in northwest Ontario.

title: Lillian Gish Lobbies for
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (UPI)  Lillian Gish, whose film career spans almost the entire history of movies, urged Congress today to preserve the historic newsreels now deteriorating in vaults.

title: Metropolitan Diary
description: MY schoolteacher grandfather is always teaching, writes Ernie Richstone. At the beach, he always announces, This is the ocean, Ernie.

title: Reporter's Notebook: Living With War in Managua Hotel
description: MANAGUA, Nicaragua, June 19 On the front steps of the InterContinental Hotel today, television cameramen scrambled to film planes firing rockets into rebelheld eastern Managua. Government officials smiled with relief at the thought that President Anastasio Somoza Debayle might still survive, and hotel workers cried silently as they watched their neighborhoods being bombed.

title: Some Favorites Decline As Market Marks Time
description: Gambling stocks and some oilexploration issues, sectors that have performed as market favorites this year, came under pressure yesterday. Meanwhile, the broad list of stocks generally displayed small price chances.

title: Saving Nicaragua From Somoza
description: The Carter Administration has urgently summoned the foreign ministers of the Americas to try, against hope, to find a democratic path out of Nicaragua's civil war. The alternatives are bleak: a victory General Somoza's National Guard that preserves his corrupt dictatorship, or a military triumph by the Sandinist guerrillas that overwhelms their partners in the battles of the past year. Now, as before, the General's refusal to depart dims the prospects for democrats.

title: David Butler, Actor On Stage and Screen And a Movie Director
description: David Butler, an actor in silent films and director of many movies, including a number of Shirley Temple's first films, died Thursday at Arcadia (Calif.) Methodist Hospital. He was 84 years old, and lived in Malibu. Calif.

title: COMMODITIES Dollar's Plunge Sends Markets Into Turmoil
description: Major commodity markets were scenes of wild trading yesterday as sudden plunge in the dollar's value combined with the threat of a nationwide truck strike and other, more normal, market influences to unsettle many traders.

title: Talmadge Terms Case Against Him Failure; Bars Further Defense
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Though he has called only one witness in six weeks of hearings, Senator Herman E. Talmadge informed the Senate Select Committee on Ethics tonight that he would offer no further defense against charges that he spent official money for personal use and failed to resort various Pi fts and inenmp Mr. Telma adge, a CrWorgia Democrat, said the committee's lawyers had failed to make their case against him. We perceive no need to rebut further the inadequate evidence special counsel has produced, he added in a letter forwarded to the committee by his lawyers.

title: BUSINESS PEOPLE
description: Leo R. Fink, chairman of the Prudential Building Maintenance Cor poration, founded its predecessor company more than 50 years ago and built it into one of the major companies in the building services field. Now at the age of 74, Mr. Fink is turning over the title of chief executive officer to Alan G. Powers, the corporation's 48yearold president, effective July 1. Mr. Fink will remain chairman.

title: Im the Same Billy Martin
description: Long before the ovation for him at Yankee Stadium last night, long before the 54 loss deflited his inauguration in his second term as manager, Billy Martin got out of a big black limousine and hurried past half a dozen photographers and about two dozen onlookers who had gathered near the press gate for the return of the native. Billy Martin is not a native New Yorker but he is a native Yankee and that's one reason why Yankee fans adore him. He spanned the transition from the DiMaggio to the Mantle years. He graduated summa cum loud from Casey Stengel's school for managers. Another reason is that he represents the essence of streetcorner smarts that New Yorkers cherish. Anybody who grew up in New York remembers a dozen kids like Billy Martin, but he made it. And now he has all those other Billy Martins out there rooting for him, hoping that somehow he'll stay out of trouble with George Steinbrenner or Reggie Jackson, or both, this time. But he won't. He wouldn't be Billy Martin if he did.

title: Muzorewa Holds Parley With the South Africans
description: SALISBURY, Zimbabwe Rhodesia, June 19 (Reuters)  Bishop Abel T. Muzorewa, Prime Minister of Zimbabwe Rhodesia, has had highlevel talks in South Africa, the Government disclosed today. Bishop Muzorewa, a black, met Prime Minister P.W. Botha and Foreign Minister Roelof F. Botha last weekend, spokesman said.

title: AntiU.S. Violence, in Turkey Worries American Community There
description: ANKARA, Turkey  The political violence that has been tormenting this country, claiming over 1,700 lives in two years, first touched the American community in Turkey in April when masked gunmen firing from a speeding car in Iimir killed an American soldier and wounded another.

title: Ballet: Stuttgart Lady of Camellias
description: ONE can only admire John Neumeier's intelligent conception VPfor his threeact Lady of the Camellias, which had its local premiere with the Stuttgart Ballet at the Metropolitan Opera House on Monday night, and one can only admire how its dancers  beginning with Egon Madsen and Marcia Haydee are able to sustain the dramatic line so strongly for so long.

title: Individual Touch In Running Shose
description: Running has arrived. Twenty million Americans  give or take 15 million have set aside their Cuisinarts, graphite tennis rackets and est manuals in favor of daily confrontation with the asphalt. Manhattan business lunches that used to resonate to the vibrations of investment tax credits and Nielsen ratings now buzz with learned debate over carbohydrateloading and aerobics. Orthopedists who only last year were struggling to build practices in lower back pain have switched to something called sports medicine and have been subsequently forced to expand their waiting rooms.

title: The U.N. Today
description: Committee on the Peaceful Uses of Outer Space 10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M.

title: BRAZIL'S PRESIDENT PLANNING AMNESTY
description: BRASILIA, June 19  The Brazilian Government is preparing an amnesty plan in response to a public clamor for pardons for thousands of citizens who lost their political rights and their jobs or were imprisoned, tortured or exiled under the military governments of the last 15 years.

title: Martin Returns to Ovations, but the Yankees Lose
description: Billy Martin was greeted by thunderous twominute standing ovation list night at Yankee Stadium when he emerged from the dugout and trotted to hoMe plate to turn in the first lineup card of his second tenure as Yankee Mantuter.

title: Arend Bouhuys, Expert on Lungs
description: Dr. Arend Bouhuys, an authority on brownling disease and a leader in thefight against jobrelated lung disease, died of a heart attack Friday on board the Oueen Elizabeth 2. He was 53 years old.

title: Energy
description: The price of heating oil could be more than 80 cents per gallon by next winter, compared with an average of 48.5 cents last winter, accordipg to industry experts. For arfayerage homeowner, the higher pricetould mean a jump in heating bills of $500 a winter or more. Industryturces also say further loss of Oil production or an unusually cold whiter could create'shoithges. [page A1.]

title: Dividends
description: TUESDAY JUNE 19, 1979

title: A Point From Defeat, Mrs. Lloyd Survives
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 19 (AP)  Chris Evert Lloyd, one point from defeat, pulled out a 46, 76, 60 secondround victory over Anne Smith in the $100,000 Eastbourne women's grass tennis tournament today, the last tuneup for next week's Wimbledon championships. Miss $mith, a 19yearold former student of religion from Dallas, was an inch from victory in the tiebreaker of the second set. She ran to the net to shake handS, believing Mrs. Lloyd had overhit on the match point. But the shot was called good, although neither player appeared to know where the ball had landed.

title: G.P.U. Wins $409 Million Credit Line
description: The General Public Utilities Corporation won approval yesterday for $409 million revolving credit line from a consortium of 43 banks, a step the company had said was crucial in helping it meet expenses stemming from im accident at its.Three Mile Island nuclear plant near Harrisburg, Pa.

title: HENRY J. CONLAND
description: Henry S. Conland, publisher of The Catksill Daily Mail and The Greene County News, which serve the Catskill Mountains area, died yesterday at his, home in Catskill, N.Y. He was 69 years old.

title: Personal Health
description: UNTIL about half a century ago, a lilywhite, peachesandcream complexion was revered among women of means, who wore widebrimmed hats and carried parasols to protect themselves from the sun. Only farrners and laborera who could not avoid being out in the sun sported tans, and eventually developed the leathery, prematurely wrinkled skin and weatherbeaten look associated with chronic exposure to the sun's ultraviolet rays.

title: Market Place
description: THE General Instrument Corporation, a hightechnology company, has long been a major factor in gambling equipment, but the speculators who have sent casino stocks to extraordinarily high levels do not seem to care.

title: Advertising
description: BACKER & SPIELVOGEL. Does. that have a ring to it?

title: Lefrak Switching From Oil To Gas to Heat 54 Buildings
description: In what the two groups described yesterday as the nation's largest residential conversion from oil to naturalgas heat, the Lefrak Organization will switch over 54 buildings housing 9,214 families before the next heating season in cooperation with the Brooklyn Union Gas Comnanv.

title: Associated Press
description: TANKER RETURNS WITH FREIGHTER CREW: Her bow crumpled by collision with the Regal Sword on Monday, the Exxon Chester a 625foot long tanker, eased into Boston Harbor yesterday, carrying the freighter's crew. Ships collided off Cape Cod, causing the freighter to sink in about 40 minutes. ;There were no serious injuries.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Chemical Leaman Corporation, Downingtown, Pa., a diversified trans.. portation company, has named Thomas R. Greenleaf president and chief executive officer. S.F. Niness Jr., executive vice president, has been named to the additional post of chief operating officer.

title: Ancient Charms of Sorrel Rediscovered
description: FOODS are as trendy as fashions and furnishings. And for the past several summers, sorrel is the food that bas captivated the palates of trend setters from Lyons to Long Island. An elegant, pungent little green, sorrel, or sour grass, now surfaces in every form imaginable. Mated with fresh salmon, sorrel sauce has become the darling of la nouvelle cuisine. A perfect foil for light and delicate foods, the slightly lemonflavored herb finds itself in fine company with eggs and fish, chicken and veal. Sorrel, which resembles spinach in texture but not in taste, can be used as a salad, or a base for soups.

title: Letters
description: To the Editor: One aspect of rampant inflation that is often overlooked by economic, political or social analysts is the cutback of corporate funds for research and development (R&D): Such cuts may satisfy the shareholder's immediate need for return on invested capital, but their longterm effects devastate future earnings and on a grander scale have dire national and international consequences.

title: Exxon Reports Price Ruling
description: HOUSTON, June 19 (AP)  The Exxon Corporation said today that ruling by United States District Judge H.O. Woodward had invalidated the Department of Energy's interpretation of a pricecontrol regulation that has led to allegations of overcharges on petroleum products. Exxon said the ruling, in Dallas on June 8, would also bar further reinterpretations by the department.

title: Satellite Photograph
description: Yesturday's Weather at t P.M.: National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration/UPI

title: Gala's Beneficiary: Statue of Liberty
description: TAKE the Statue of Liberty, given by France to honor FrenchAmerican ties, a museum at its base that needs money for an educational outreach program, a business firm that bridges the two countries, and isn't averse to spending money in the cause of publicity and good will. Put them all tonether and out Dons a benefit.

title: Bridge:
description: A notable double has been completed during the last month by two New York players. David Daly and Joe Donath won the Harter Cup, limited to players below life master rank, teamed with Rick Zucker, Mark Rosenfeld and Marvin Kurtz. They won the final by 9 international match points against a group headed by Bill Dinner after a double elimination knockout that began last October.

title: The Tomatoes in Your Future
description: Unless reason prevails, the Treasury Department, by a single decision, is about to exacerbate tensions with oilrich Mexico, guarantee higher prices for vegetables next winter and increase the flow of illegal aliens into the. Southwest. Reason, however, has little to do with the nation's trade regulations in general, and perishable Mexican tomatoes in nartienlar.

title: Deaths
description: BAILENElise Thompson. On Jum 19, 1979. Wife of Eliot. Mother o?? Ann, Emily and Tom. Sister of Johr Blauvelt, Virginia Northacker, Ter once Thompson and William E Thompson. Service at Church of the Heavenly Rest, Sth Avenue at 90th Street, Friday at 2PM.

title: World News Briefs
description: BAGHDAD, Iraq, June 19 (AP) Presidents Ahmed Hassan alBakr of Iraq and Hafez alAssad of Syria ended their unification talks here today with the formation of a joint political command, short of a full political union.

title: Shipping/Mails
description: SAILING TODAY

title: Economic Scene
description: EVEN before the oil ministers of the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries meet in Geneva next Tuesday, the Western nations are experiencing a bad case of the jitters waiting to see how much higher the price of oil will go. But the outcome of the OPEC meeting nromises few surprises. ine otnciat price will surely rise. The Saudis, the only ones who have kept their price well below the rest of OPEC, have let it be known that they are under tremendous pressure to raise the price of oil to what it really is.

title: Where Will the Budget Buck Stop?
description: After wrangling long past the legal deadline, New York's City Council and Board of Estimate propose add $40 million in expenditures to Mayor Koch's $12.8billion budget for the year beginning July 1. And now, invoking the press of time, members of both bodies are warning the Mayor not to veto the increases. The fittine response to these windy threats is to ismore them.

title: About Real Estate Retailing Flourishes on Third Avenue in the 40's and 50's
description: Upstairs, the office space on Third Avenue in the 40's and 50's is filled. When space does become available, it is renting at about $14 to $18 a square foot, or even up to $20 a square foot, according to one owner.

title: Joint Chieh Said to Assure Carter OfSupport for Treaty With Soviet
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The nation's top military leaders, the Joint Chiefs of Staff, have told President Carter they will support the new strategic arms treaty with the Soviet Union when it goes before the Senate, White House and Detense Department officials said today.

title: Chinese Report Treaty, Offering No Comment
description: PEKING, June 19 (Agence FrancePresse)  China today reported the Vienna summit meeting between the Soviet leader, Leonid I. Brezhnev, and President Carter, giving the gist of the agreement without comment.

title: Howe to Understand and Deal With Children's Fear of the Water
description: You've seen him at the beach: the terrified child screamingwhile his father dandles him in the surf and makes noises that say, This is really fun! Or at the pool: the child crouched apart, and shivering in misery, while her peers in the water surround her with the din of their delight.

title: Chess:
description: Hypermodern openings can give rise to mating attacks, although you'd never guess it from perusing what hypermoderns have to say about strategy. Involved as they are in the fine points of pawn structure, weak squares and overprotection, they apparently ignore the mating attack because they deem it either vulgar or too obvious to deserve their sophisticated consideration.

title: New Plan Shortening ServiceStation Lines On Parkway in Jersey
description: WOODBRIDGE, N.J., June 19  New Jersey officials expressed relief as an oddeven gasoline rationing plan on the Garden State Parkway went into effect today and shortened the lines of customers that had clogged the road's 13 gasoline stations since late last week.

title: Federal Officials Seek to Head Off Truckers Stoppage Set for Tonight
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Top Federal officials, in an increasingly anxious atmosphere, met at the White House this afternoon to discuss. steps to get, independenttruckeri3 back to work and head off a nationwide work stoppage called for 11:59 P.M. tomorrow.

title: Radio
description: 78 A.M., WNCN. Le Rol d'Ys, Overture, Lalo; Salome, Dance of the 7 Veils, Strauss; Scherzo; Allegro, Beethoven; United States Grand Waltz, Grote; Schwanda: Polka, Weinberger.

title: Early Radiation Safety Problems Laid to ABomb Program's Pace
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The scientific breakthroughs that led to the atomic bomb and then to thermonuclear weapons came so swiftly that the Government was unable to deal effectively with many of the problems the advances created, former member of the Atomic Energy Commission told a Senate committee today.

title: Associated Press
description: PESTICIDE RECOVERY CONTINUES IN MAINE: While a Maine Forest Service helicopter hovered overhead, Forest Service personnel continued the unloading of 800 gallons of the pesticide, Sevin, from a partly submerged C54 aircraft that crashed last Thursday in Eagle Lake, near Millinocket. Since the crash, the plane was towed to shore to recover the chemical.

title: U.S. Agency Sets Trade In Treasury Bill Futures
description: The Commodity Futures Trading Commission authorized four commodity exchanges yesterday to start trading in Treasury bills and notes for future delivery. In doing so, the Federal regulatory agency cast aside the objections of the Treasury and Federal Reserve Board, which opposed the proliferation of financialinstrument futures as possible impediments to their debt management operations.

title: Gilbert W. Humphrey, Chairman Of Hanna Conglomerate, Is Dead
description: Gilbert Watts Humphrey, chairman of the Hanna Mining Company, an iron ore and nickel conglomerate, died Sunday of complications of a circulatory disease after undergoing exploratory surgery Saturday at Community Hospital in Carmel, Calif. He was 62 years old and lived in Cleveland.

title: Daughter Reads Poem at Rites for Slain Policeman
description: Hundreds of police officers and other mourners attended funeral services yesterday for Ted W. Donald, a Housing Authority police officer who was shot dead last Friday in a Bronx housing project while investieatine a reported burelarv.

title: Deaths
description: MINTONLouise (Gay). Age 102. The daughter of the late Matilda and William Gay of Memphis. Tennessee. Widow of Roger Medina Minton of N.Y.C. Interment in Jacksonville, Florida. In lieu of flowers contributions may be sent to Greenwich House, 27 Barrow Street, N.Y., N.Y. 10014.

title: Democrats Choose Feldman To Run for Top Suffolk Post
description: HAUPPAUGE, L.I., June 17 Suffolk County Democrats met here tonight, and in a 50minute meeting they designated Dr. Martin. J. Feldman by acclamation for the County Executive nomination in what could be one of the most significant elections in the state this offyear.

title: Liichow's Restaurant Is Sold to Aschkenasy
description: The restaurateur Peter Aschkenasysaid last night that he had bought Liichow's, the 97yearold GermanAmerican restaurant on 14th Street near Union Square, which closed last Sunday. He said he would refurbish it and reopen it in the fall.

title: REBECCA C. GORDON
description: Rebecca C. Gordon, wife of the late Richard H. Gordon, a Wall Street stock broker and a minority owner of the Pepperidge Farm Company, died Sunday at her home in North Salem, N.Y. She was 89 years old.

title: Business Records
description: V.C.N. BOOKS AND CARDS LTD.. doing business as Fulton Books and Cards, 145 Fulton St., N.Y. The petitioners are Paramount Line Inc., Simon & Schuster Inc., and Norcross Inc. Debts amount to $6,289.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: SO IN KEY Broadway's gypsy grapevine had it that the new singing hostess over at Open Call, a lively, informal aftertheater rendezvous in the Edison Hotel, was something special. She is. Her name is Gale Bradley.

title: Companies List Earnings
description: For peripds as shown. (N) Indicates stock is listed on the New York Stock Exchange, (A) the American Exchange and (0) overthecounter.

title: Art of Psychiatric Center On View at City Museum
description: An exhibition of art by mentally disturbed chronic patients and by outpatients in work programs of the Bronx Psychiatric Center is on display at the Museum of the City of New York. The show will be on view through Sept. 9.

title: Treaty Backers Are Resigned to Some Senate Changes
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Althoug the Carter Administration and the Sovieth leadership have warned that drastic modifications might kill the strategic arms limitation treaty signed yesterday, a White House official said today: There is no question the Senate is going to insist on putting its imprint on the SALT treaty.

title: Manager Coaches At Third
description: Billy Martin, intent on directing the Yankees to their third pennant under him, returned to.Yankee Stadium last night not in one capacity, as manage'', but in three  manager, scout and thirdbase coach.

title: Dining in France: On the Trail Of Excellence
description: THIS first report on a fiveweek eating trip throughout France and briefly in Belgium unfortunately must contain a message that is not likely to be considered good news. The advice to, traveling food btiffs is to take boxes full of cash (credit cards are rarely accepted at top restaurants) and realize that while it can still buy some of the world's best food, it can also buy a higher percentage of disappointing meals than ever before.

title: FOREIGN AFFAIRS
description: LONDON  A turnabout, or a blind alley? Britons are asking this question in light of Prime Minister Margaret. Thatcher's first budget unveiled last week. The new British leader has embarked on a bold, highrisk strategy to change the way the British economy is run and to reverse 25 years of Industrial decline.

title: New Yorkers.etc.
description: THERE are some things that are never going to happen. The sooner we all accept this, the better of we'll be.

title: Several Banks Cutting Prime
description: Several of the nation's largest commercial banks joined the trend to lower interest rates yesterday by cutting their prime lending rates from 11 percent to 11 percent.

title: Deaths
description: HAIMOVITZ  Benlamin. Beloved father of Evelyn and Paul Nalitt, Julius and Ruth, cherished grandfather and great grandfather. Services today at 10AM Kirschenbaum's 1153 Coney Island Ave, (Ave H) Bklyn.

title: Crack Was Allegedly Seen in 77 Before Motor Fell
description: The first,cracked undercarriage on the new subway cars purchased by the city from Pullman Inc: may have: been detected by the Transit. Authority earlier than transit officials have been saving.

title: Truckers, Protesting Fuel Price, Blockade Jersey Gasoline Depot
description: Independent truckers yesterday blockaded the Carteret, N.J., fuel depot that supplies gasoline for the pumps serving all of the New Jersey Turnpike's state police cars, wreckers and maintenance vehicles, as well as the fuel storage tanks of police and fire departments in 10 northern northern New Jersey towns.

title: House Panels to Look for Surplus in U.N. Finances
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  Two House Foreign Affairs subcommittees announced today that they would begin joint hearings. June 27 on. the budgetary and financial practices of the United Nations and its specialized agencies.

title: Asarco and Others Lift Copper Prices
description: Marco Inc. was among several companies that announced increases in copper and other metals prices. Marco raised its domestic spot selling price of electrolytic copper cathodes by a cent to 89 cents a pound on a delivered basis The Noranda Sales Corporation, unit of Noranda Mines Ltd., Toronto, lifted its prices of electrolytic copper cathodes in the United States by 4 cents to 90 cents. The Duval Corporation, a unit of the Pennzoil Company, increased its cathode price by 4 cents to 90 cents a pound.

title: News of the Theater Nichols Returning With 2 Shows
description: MIKE NICHOLS, who was conspicuously absent from the Broadway scene this past season  he worked Off director of E.L. Doctoeow's Drinks Before, Dinner'plans to come back next fall with two new Broadway productions. He will direct as well as coproduce, with William Kosmas, a fourcharacter musical called Partners. Tommy Tune will choreograph the show, which Mr. Nichols describes as being about menand women in New York  a very contemporary story. The book, music and lyrics are by Jeffrey A. Moss, a former writer for Sesame Street who will be making his Broadway debut. Mr. Nichols will also coproduce, with Lewis Allen, the romantic comedy Blau and Pignoli. The play, written by and starring Renee Taylor and Joseph Bologna, will be directed by Elaine May.

title: 4 Confirmed by Senate As Circuit Court Judges
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP)  The Senate confirmed today by voice vote President Carter's nominations of two Federal district judges, a law professor and a practicing lawyer to be circuit court judges.

title: Personal Income Up 0.7% in May
description: WASHINGTON, June 19 (AP) The personal income of Americans rose modest seventenths of 1 percent last month, recovering slightly from the strikedepressed level of the previous month, the Government said today.

title: Carey Uses His Influence On Widow's Pension Bill
description: ALBANY, June 19  Governor Carey, Who has railed at the Legislature for passing special retirement benefits for individual constituents, used his influence in the waning hours of the legislative session to get a $13,500ayear pension increase for the widow of a Southampton, L.I., policeman.

title: United Press International
description: MAKES THE DOUBLE PLAY: John Summers of Tigers tried to take Jerry Remy, Red Sox second baseman, out the play after being forced out in the fourth inning at Fenway Park in Boston last night, but Remy made leaping throw to first to double Aurelio Rodriguez.

title: Ron Franklin Arrested On Cocaine Charge
description: ANAHEIM, Calif., June 19 (AP)Ron Franklin, the 19yearold jockey who rode Spectacular Bid to victories in two of the three Triple Crown races this year, was arrested in the parking lot at Disneyland yesterday on a charge of possession of cocaine, the police said taday.

title: Hearing on California Court Hints At 2 Justices Role in News Report
description: SAN FRANCISCO, June 19  The finger of suspicion was pointed today, in a most tentative way, at two California Supreme Court justices as perhaps having made unauthorized disclosures to two Los Angeles Times reporters about a controversial case whose decision had not been filed.

title: Money
description: TUESDAY, JUNE 19, 1979

title: Q&A
description: Q. I am curious to know about the origin of the veal dish called saltimbocca. I know its etymology  saltim (jump) and bocca (mouth)  but how did it originate?

title: Chemenko Emerges at Summit Talks as the Man Closest to Brezhnev
description: VIENNA, June 19  Konstantin U. Chemenko, a 67yearold member of the Soviet Politburo, did not say a word in the exchanges with the Americans in the 10 hours of summit meetings that ended yesterday. But he emerged as the man personally closest to Leonid I. Brezhnev.

title: Thrift Units To Regain Rate Edge
description: Savings institutions across the United States will be allowed beginning tomorrow to offer higher rates than commercial banks on sixmonth moneymarket certificates, the first time this has occurred since midMarch.

title: Obituary 4 -- No Title
description: DOBSONNathan. On June 19, 1979 at home. Devoted husband of the late Edith Folkman. Beloved father of Joan Baron, Helen Vinlk and Muriel Palltz. Dear grandfather of Marcia and Lisa Baron, Lauren Cox, Paul and Carolyn Klemow, Michael and Suzanne Palitz. Greatgrandfather. Brother of Augusta Fein and Carrie Trager and brotherinlaw of Sadie Folkman. Friends may call at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st Street, Wednesday, 79 P.M. Service Thursday, 1 P.M. In lieu of flowers, send donations to Surgical Research Division, Mt. Sinai Hospital, New York City.

title: Wood, Field and Stream Treaty Seen Threat To Wildlife System
description: This nation's wildlife management system  regarded by many as the most enlightened and successful in the world  could be damaged by a 63nation convention under way in Bonn, West Germany, says Jack Berryman, executive vice president of the International Association of Fish and Wildlife Agencies.

title: Private Lives
description: HIS sister snapped a photograph of the Latin scholar in his fancy new duds, and then he was off, into the future. Yes, he remembered the corsage, which he pinned on his date when he picked her up at her father's house. Yes, there is still such a thing as a date. She is also a Latin scholar. They went to a restaurant for seafood. and the maitre d'htel treated them as though they were honeymooners. They were joined by other Latin scholars in fancy new duds, and the conversation was so intense that they were almost late for the prom. It was agreed that the music at the prom was surprisingly adequate. They danced themselves insensible. When they were done dancing, they got into the car and drove through the night to the coast of Florida. They slept on the beach. They watched the sun rise out of the water. They ate pizza for breakfast.

title: Margaret Bancroft, 87, ExColumbia Historian
description: Margaret Bancroft, a former professor of ancient history at Columbia University who held a monthly salon for students and friends at her Morningside Heights apartment, died Tuesday of cancer at St. Luke's Hospital. She was 87 years old. miss tsancrolt, a graduate of Wellesley College with a master's degree from Columbia University, joined Columbia's School of General Studies in 1923 after teaching four years at Wellesley. She continued graduate studies at Cambridge in England.

title: Group Says South Africa Put $11 Million Into U.S. News Media Deals
description: The Government of South Africa invested more than $11 million through conservative Michigan newspaper publisher, John P. McGoff, in his unsuccessful attempt to buy The Washineton Star his purchase of The Sacramento Union and his purchase of controlling interest in United Press International Television News, according to the report of a South African Investigating commission looking into that country's $74 million public relations scandal.

title: Stakes High as Senate Examines Cancer in Troops at Atom Tests
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  In the infancy of the atomic bomb, the military sent the first of what would become a quarter of a million troops onto war games battlefields to try their courage and their equipment. Today those nu. clear weapons tests are the object of other concerns  whether radiation from the blasts gave the men cancer.

title: Army Major in El Salvador Killed; Leftists Said to Be Responsible
description: SAN SALVADOR, June 19 (AP) Army Maj. Armando de Paz was shot dead by machine gun today as he drove to his job at the Defense Ministry here, the authorities said.

title: Milan Communist Office Raided
description: MILAN, Italy, June 19 (Reuters)  A Communist Party office in Milan was damaged early today by two fire bombs thrown by three armed youths, the. police said. Nobody was injured in the attack. The neoFascist Armed Revolutionary Nuclei took responsibility for the attack.

title: Best Buys
description: THE nationwide truckers stemdown continues to cause delays in shipments of produce, meat and poultry to the New York area, but chances of immediate shortages are slight. Both wholesale and retau zoos merchants report spotty and sporadic delays in the transport of perishable foodstuffs, with many deliveries arriving hours to days behind schedule.

title: WASHINGTON
description: VIENNA; June 19The central and poignant figure at the Vienna summit conference was President Leonid I. Brezhnev of the Soviet Union  not because he dominated the proceedings but because he didn't.

title: But Rules Split May Postpone Floor Debate
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  A considerably strengthened version of President Carter's proposed tax on oil companies windfall profits won approval in the House Ways and Means Committee today by a vote of 20 to 16.

title: SENATE VOTES DELAY IN SPEEDYTRIAL ACT
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The Senate voted unanimously today to defer for two years the enforcement of a law that requires the automatic dismissal of criminal cases in Federal District Courts if the defendants are not brought to trial within 100 days of arrest.

title: Cosmos Put Marinho On Defense
description: BLOOMINGTON, Minn., June 19 Francisco Marinho, the flamboyant Brazilian who has been an offensive weapon for the Cosmos, will be moved to defense, the coaches of the team have decided.

title: Citicorp 91Day Note Sale
description: Liticorp reported yesterday that had sold $100 million of 91day notes at an average rate of 9.907 percent, up slightly from the 9.895 percent a week ago. The bank holding company received $681 million of bids, down from $1.02 billion last week, with those accepted ranging in rate from 9.759 to 9.930 percent.

title: TV RATINGS
description: Following are the top 15 national television shows the past week (Monday, June 11, to Sunday, June 17), listed according to their rank in the ratings compiled by the A.G. Nielsen Company. A rating is a percentage of the total number of United States households with television sets.

title: How GasBuyinK Plans Work
description: Following is a summary of regulations governing the purchase and sale of gasoline in the New York City area and in New Jersey and Connecticut. Some changes were still being made late yesterday.

title: Hassler Bows, 31
description: HOUSTON, June 19  Tvio silver medals, one a religious medallion and one a silver disk with his uniform number, stuck to Joaquin Andujar's sweaty chest. The 26yearold pitcher from the Dominican Republic had just thrown the fifth twohitter in his threeyear career and the Astros had beaten the Mets, 31. Without a run until the eighth inning, the Mets lengthened their string of scoreless innings to 29, stretching back to the first inning of last night's 18inning loss to the Astros.

title: Senators Decide Against Seeking ExPresidents Views on Treaty
description: WASHINGTON, June 19  The Senate Foreign Relations Committee today sidestepped the questiOn. of inviting former President Richard M. Nixon to testify on the strategic arms treaty, electing not to invite any former President.

title: Stage: Miller's Price Moves to Broadway
description: ARTHUR MILLER'S The Price is an obsessive excavation of a family's pasttrand a cool Judgment on the value of such excavations: both at once.

title: Early Radiation Safety Problems Laid to A-Bomb Program's Pace
description: From the Mayor to the New York sports establishment, to the fan who spends up to $7 a ticket on a game, Billy Martin's dramatic return as Yankee manager, yesterday made an impression.

title: British Cite Trade Gap For May
description: LONDON, June 19  Britain reported another set of depressing trade figures today, pointing toward a steep 1979 deficit that may far exceed projections made last week by Margaret Thatcher's new Conservative Government.

title: Goodspeed Opera Revives The Five O'Clock Girl
description: flee Five O'Clock Girl, a musical about love and social standing that appeared on Broadway in 1927, has started a 12week run at the Goodspeed Opera House in East Haddam, Conn. Sue Lawless directed.

title: The New York Time/ Larry C. Morris
description: CHANGE OF LUCK: A pensive Tommy John of Yanks during Blue Jay rally at Stadium Tuesday. Blue Jays handed John (104) his second straight loss with 54 victory.

title: Warranty Terms On Subway Cars Altered in 1972
description: A provision that would have required Pullman Inc. to replace at its own cost experimental equipment in subway cars produced for New York City was removed from the contract in return for a $25.2 million decrease in the price of the cars undercarriages, Transit Authority documents disclose.

title: The Region
description: NEWARK (AP)  Doctors say the prognosis is good for Patricia Isla, 30 years old, and her twopound baby girl, Vanessa Lee, who was born 12 hours after Mrs. Isla underwent heart surgery last week at Beth Israel Medical Center here.

title: Parents Upheld On Committing Minor Children
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The Supreme Court, in a 6to3 ruling today, upheld the constitutionality of state laws that allow parents to commit their minor children to stateimental institutions.

title: What It Costs
description: The following are current rule-ofthumb landscaping costs used by Bradford M. Greene, a New York landscape architect, for work in the metropolitan area. Prices, which are based on square yards and include delivery and installation, are those one might expect a nursery or landscape contractor to use in calculating job estimates:

title: Swiss Lawyers Beat City Hail
description: GENEVA, June 20  A policecourt judge quashed 28 parking tickets today of ruling that two lawyers had the right to park in a space that seven state, councillors had reserved for themselves. Judge AnneFrancoise Comte said parking space was too limited for it not to be open to all on a firstcome, firstserved basis.

title: Technology
description: UNABLE to meet the demand for unleaded gasoline, petroleum refiners are turning to other chemicals to extend available supplies and squeeze more usable fuel out of a barrel of oil. The

title: U.S. Bows to Governors On ExportLicense Rules
description: CEDAR RAPIDS, Iowa, June 20 The nation's governors, undertaking a new political role, have, in effect, forced the Carter Administration to be more permissive in the granting of export licensm

title: Robert Wilson's Edison Playing at Lion Theater
description: Edison, a fouract, threehour play conceived and directed by Robert Wilson, is being presented through Sunday as a work-in-progress at the Lion Theater, 422 West 42d Street.

title: Home Beat
description: Furn, 1 bdrm, no bth

title: Astros Subdue Mets, 54
description: HOUSTON, June 20  The Mets lost their third game in three days to the Houston Astros tonight, 54, as three members of the New York team were ejected in the ninth inning and as Joe Sambito recorded his second outstanding relief appearance of the series.

title: New York World TV Festival Is Set
description: A threeweek New York World Television Festival, which its founders hope will become an annual event for industry professionals and interested members of the general public, will take place in Manhattan next fall to display a representative array of the world's best television Programs.

title: LINES AT GAS PUMPS SEEM TO BE SHORTER
description: New York Again Permits Metering by HalfGallon at Stations

title: Blumenthal Wary On a Big OPEC Rise
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  Treasury Secretary W. Michael Blumenthal said that the economy was slowing in the right way and that a serious downturn could be avoided, but he warned that, if oilcountry ministers did not show restraint at their Geneva pricing meeting next week, the world could tumble into another recession.

title: New Accord Reached in Paper Strike
description: AUGUSTA, Me., June 20 (AP)  An end to the strike that threatened the paper supplies of some of the nation's top magazine publishers appeared at hand today as union and management ,negotiators for the St. Regis Paper Company announced a tentative contract agreement.

title: Policeman Held in Mail Bombiiig That Killed Officer and Hurt Two
description: BESSEMER, Ala., June 20 (AP) former police sergeant was arrested yesterday and charged with murder in the May 2 mail bombing that killed police lieutenant and maimed two other men, the authorities said.

title: Creation of U.S. Radiation Panel Is Urged in Federal Health Study
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (UPI)  A Government report today recommended the creation of a council to set Federal ,radiation protection standards and steps to correct specific deficiencies in Federal policy.

title: Japan Cites Narrower Surplus
description: TOKYO, June 20 (Reuters) Japan's customscleared trade surplus narrowed to $33.2 million in the first 10 days of June from $988.6 million in the yearearlier period, the Finance Ministry said. The nation had a $495.6 million deficit in the similar period in May.

title: Jana Angelakis Captures Women's Fencing Crown
description: COLORADO SPRINGS, June 20 Jana Angelakis, an 18yearold from Peabody, Mass., compiled a perfect 50 record in the finals to win the United States national women's fencing championship at the Air Force Academy last night.

title: Carter Welcomes Solar Power
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  President Carter climbed atop the roof of the White House today and, amid a noonday blaze of solar power, dedicated a solar heating system and announced his solar energy Plan.

title: Films on African Women In Symphony Space Series
description: The African Woman Series, six rarely seen films on African women, will open Saturday with Sambizanga, an Angolan film by Sarah Maldoror, at the Symphony Space, Broadway at 95th Street.

title: Books of TheTimes
description: WE are in Greece during World War II, a time of occupation by the enemy, of firing squads in the quarry, of guerrillas in the mountains, of famine and plague and informers and poisoned fish. The young boy, who has no name, thinks and dreams:

title: Mattel's Diversified Comeback
description: LOS ANGELES, June 20  Mattel Inc., the nation's largest toymaker, abandoned its popular slogan, If. it's Mattel, it's swell, sometime ago. The reason, according to one shareholder attending the company's annual meeting last week, was that, until last year, things have been lousy at Mattel.

title: G.O.P. in House Gives No. 3 Job To Rep. Devine
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)  Representative Samuel L. Devine of Ohio today was elected chairman of the House Republican Conference, the thirdranking post in the House Republican leadership. The vote was 75 to 72.

title: Car Output Off 18.3% in Britain
description: LONDON, June 20 (AP)  Britain's output of passenger cars fell by 18.3 percent to an average weekly total of 24,231 units in April from 29,778 units in April 1978, the Society of Motor Manufacturers and Traders reported today.

title: World News Briefs
description: ROME, June 20  Nilde Jotti, a Corn. munist, was elected President of the Ital. Ian Chamber of Deputies tonight with the support of the ruling Christian Democrats and other parties. She is the first woman toehold this post.

title: Letters
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: Solar Film Cuts Cost Of AirConditioning
description: ONCE only people wore sunglasses. Now ordinary windows are wearing them. The fad hits a solid economic motivation: soaring electricity rates.

title: French Socialist Leader Resigns From New European Parliament
description: PARIS, June 20 (AP)  Francois Mitterrand, leader of the Socialist Party, dramatically quit the new European Parliament today to protest an official recount that gave a Socialist seat to the ruling centerright coalition.

title: Advertising
description: DENIM is the name of a men's fragrance line that Lever Brothers will be introducing in the fall with a huge ad budget and a commercial that makes its sales pitch as a woman's hand unsnaps the cuff and pocket snaps on a man's denim shirt.

title: Beaths
description: HALPERN Emanuel. Sovereign Senators Knights of Pythias announces with deep sorrow the passing of their beloved Past Chancellor and Life member.

title: Milwaukee Road Can Seek Route Cuts
description: CHICAGO, June 20 (AP)  A United States District Court judge said yesterday that the financially ailing Milwaukee Road could begin asking Federal regulators for permission to discontinue service on some of its rail routes in the Middle West.

title: ESSAY Right On Tops
description: CANNES, France  Only a generation ago, while picking my way along this pebbly beach, I was struck by a phenomenon so European and avant garde that it seemed certain never to spread to American shores: the bikini. Nearnudity, on public display. Shocking! wnat sociological pundit would have dared to suggest, back then, that the wispy tops and Gstringy bottoms of the bathing suits sported by defiant young French women would soon become not only accepted but traditional at Malibu, Miami Beach and Coney Island?

title: THORPE LOSES BAIL AS JURY GETS CASE
description: LONDON, June 20  After deliberating for six hours in the murder conspiracy trial of Jeremy Thorpe, the jury retired to a hotel late this afternoon without having reached a verdict, and Mr. Thorpe, his bail canceled, was taken away to spend the night in jail.

title: Soviet Satirist Says His Book Is Realism
description: IT is Soviet life that is the real satire. My book is not a satire. My description of the Soviet 'satire is not a satire. It is traditional realism.

title: HalfGallon Pricing Ordered Again
description: ALBANY, June 20  At the request of the State Energy Commissioner, the Department of Agriculture and Markets renewed its order late today allowing dealers to price gasoline by the halfgallon, effective at noon tomorrow.

title: Reversing Law Enforcement in Suffolk
description: A series of court reversals has exposed an alarming pattern of official behavior in Suffolk County. Repeatedly, police officers, jailers, prosecutors and trial judges have violated the rights of arrested persons, or winked at such violations. Repeatedly, suspects have been cut off from their lawyers and families while the authorities have questioned them at length, often extracting confessions and other evidence that were later thrown out as improperly obtained. Half a dozen times in three years, New York's highest court has overturned convictions in Suffolk on these grounds.

title: United Press International
description: Sydney Maree, left, winning 5,000 meters at N.C.A.A. championships earlier this month. A meet in New Jersey Saturday will let Maree run despite international ban on South Africans. Story, D16.

title: Soviet Five Triumphs
description: TURIN, Italy, June 20 (AP) Vladimir Tkacenko scored 29 points to lead the Soviet Union team to a 98.75 victory over Israel and the European basketball championship tonight. Yugoslavia, the defending champion, placed third and Czechoslovakia was fourth in the tournament.

title: Business Leaders Establish Panel As Watchdog
description: Declaring that city officials had failed to create an effective criminaljustice system, a group of prominent businessmen yesterday announced the formation of a permanent Citizens Crime Commission as an independent watchdog grouv.

title: Dance: The Indigenous At Festival in Durham
description: DURHAM, N.C., June 20  Mary Ellen Edwards, 63 years old and dressed., in an elegant beige pants suit, got down on all fours on a stage, chanted a little rhyme for nearly a minute, and walked off smiling as an audience at Duke University's Page Auditorium . whooped with delight.

title: Home Improvement
description: ALTHOUGH most room airconditioners are installed in windows, in recent years an increasing number of homeowners have been opting for throughthewall installations. In addition, many people who have window airconditioners are now Interested in taking these units out of the window and installing them through an outside wall.

title: Tension at Hartsdale Gas Station Eases as OddEven Plan Begins
description: HARTSDALE, N.Y., June 20  The line of cars waiting for, gasoline at James O'Roluice's busy Mobil station on Hartsdale Avenue shrank this morning, the tirst day of oddeven rationing, from dozen.s of cars and an hour,'s wait at7 &M. to eight cars and a 10minute wait around 10 A.M.

title: Bonn Opposition Split on Candidate for Chancellor
description: BONN, June 20  In daily installments, West Germans beim been receiving reports for the last two weeks about the battle within the Christian Democratic and Christian Social Union parties over who will be chosen as the parties candidate for Chancellor in next year's national election.

title: He Gives Up $24,000; Gains Pride of Family
description: WEYMOUTH, Mass., June'20 (AP)  Robert McDonald, a 31yearold man with a mortgage, a wife and two small children, was driving behind an armored truck yesterday when its rear dcor swung open and out spilled two money bags.containing nearly $20,9011.

title: Opera: Traviata
description: THE indoor passions of La Tmviata brought a nice warmth to the cool air at Central Park's Sheep Meadow on Tuesday night. It was the second of the two Verdi works being presented by the Metropolitan Opera this summer in concert versions in the city parks. The weather was perfect, as it has been for all the performances of Aida and Traviata so far. In this respect it has been an unusually fortunate season for the opera company and its audiences.

title: UGANDAN PRESIDENT OUT AFTER 10 WEEKS
description: KAMPALA, Uganda, June 20  In a surprise move, Yusufu K. Lule resigned today as President of Uganda, an office he had held less than 10 weeks after the overthrow of Idi Amin. Within hours, Godfrey L. Binaisa, a 59yearold Britishtrained lawyer who once served as Attorney General under Milton Obote, was sworn in as President.

title: A Summary of the Actions Taken This Year by the New York State Legislature
description: ALBANY, June 20  Following are some of the major actions taken by the New York State Legislature during the 1979 session, which recessed last Sunday morning:

title: Pop: Songs Of Swing At Marty's
description: ALTHOUGH nostalgia has been worked over pretty regularly in recent years by performers who have something to be nostalgic about, Helen Forrest, who is singing at Marty's, Third Avenue at 73d Street, this week and next, has found a somewhat different perspective in which to put the swingband career that brought her fame.

title: Surveillance of Telephone Dialing Without Use of Warrant Is Backed
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The Supreme Court ruled today that the police do not need a search warrant before installing a device that records the numbers dialed from a particular telephone.

title: COMPANY NEWS
description: QUEBEC, June 20  A bill authorizing the Quebec government to expropriate the assets of the Americancontrolled Asbestos Corporation, Canada's secondlargest asbestos producer, was passed by the Assembly today.

title: Recent Rise in Rail Travel Prompts Carter to Review Amtrak Cutbacks
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)  The Carter Administration speed today to review its plan,to cut back on passenger trains end decided instead to preserve trains where ridership is increasing.

title: U.S. Olympic Ski Team Selects Koch, 6 Others
description: LAKE PLACID, N.Y., June 20 (AP)  Seven veteran Nordic skiers, including Bill Koch, 1976 Olympic crosscountry medalist from Guilford, Vt., have been named to the United States team for the 1980 Winter Games here.

title: Money
description: WEDNESDAY, JUNE 20, 1979

title: Mexican Oil for Sweden
description: STOCKHOLM, June 20 (UPI)  The newly appointed Mexican Foreign Minister, Jorge Castaileda, on a threeday visit here to discuss bilateral trade and general issues, said Mexican oil could be made available to Sweden by 1981 at the rate of 70,000 barrels a day. For Mexico, Sweden is an ideal trading partner, he said. Besides being an honest country, Sweden is also a medium power with highly advanced technology, which complements very much the state of development of Mexico.

title: Secret Senate Hearings on Arms Treaty Called Crucial
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  Prolonged and exhaustive public hearings will be conducted this summer by two Senate committees on the proposed armslimitation treaty. But the shorter, secret hearings by the Select Committee on Intelligence may do considerably more to influence'. key votes when the treaty comes .up for approval on the Senate floor.

title: Increase In Gasoline Output Due
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  Energy Secretary James R. Schlesinger is expected to disclose tomorrow that most oil refiners have agreed to produce more gasoline during the coming weeks, Administration officials said today.

title: V.A. WILL LOOK AGAIN AT RADIATION CLAIMS
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The general counsel to the Veterans Administration told the Senate Committee on Veterans Affairs today that the V.A. would take another look at the 229 claims it has rejected from veterans who were exposed to radiation at nuclear weapons tests and were asking for compensation for disabilities, including cancer.

title: Hardee's Will Add 155 Restaurants
description: Hardee's Food Systems said that it planned to add 155 new restaurants in the fiscal year ending Oct. 31. The Rocky Mount, N.C.based operator of fastfood restaurants currently has 1,125 units, both owned and franchised.

title: Soviet Union Buys U.S. Corn
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)  The Soviet Union has bought an additional 700,000 metric tons of American corn for delivery through Sept. 30, the Agriculture Department said today.

title: HELPFUL HARDWARE
description: THERE are two interesting and unusual brooms on the market: the Jetaway Water Broom and Julius Caruso's Mr. Broom, deve'oped by the hairdresser to clean his salon's floors.

title: Weavil Paces Golfers
description: MADISON, Wis., June 20 (UPI) Ken Weavil of WinstonSalem, N.C., shot a twounderpar 70 today and took a oneshot lead over Hall Fowler of Woodstock, Ga., in the qualifying round of the National Association of LeftHanded Golfers tournament.

title: Lotion On Closing City Hospitals
description: To the Editor:

title: Carey Vetoes BankTie Bill
description: ALBANY, June 20  Governor Carey announced his veto today of a bill that . would have expanded the New York State Banking Board's power to control acquisitions by banks and bankholding companies in New York State.

title: Equity Sets New Code For Off Off Broadway
description: Although the Off Off Broadway Alliance said on Monday that its member theaters would no longer operate under the Equity code governing actors, Actors Equity announced yesterday that it had formulated a new and liberalized code for Off Off Broadway theaters that would go into effect on Sept. I.

title: Market Place
description: AMERICAN HEALTH SERVICES, an owneroperator of psychiatric and general hospitals in Washington and points south, hopes to go private, and at least a few shareholders are unhappy about this.

title: Minnesota Guard and Patrolmen Appear to Have Halted Blockades
description: ST. PAUL, June 20  More than 500 National Guardsmen and 400 members of the State Highway Patrol, called into action under a 'state of emergency declared by Gov. Albert H. Quie, appeared today to have put an end to the blockades and much of the picketing by innepenclent truckers at refineries, tank farms and pipeline terminals that had caused a sharp dwindling of Minnesota's available gasoline and diesel fuel supplies.

title: Baryshnikov Named to Direct Ballet Theater Starting in 1980
description: The American Ballet Theater yesterday named Mikhail Baryshnikov, the former Soviet ballet star who is now with the New York City Ballet, as its next artistic director.

title: The New York Times/ Keith Meyers
description: Some of the 14 tankers lying at anchor in Delaware Bay waiting to be unloaded yesterday at refineries in Delaware and Philadelphia

title: VANCE ASKING OAS. TO AID IN NICARAGUA
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  Secretary of State Cyrus R. Vance will try tomorrow to enlist members of the Organization of American States in a collective effort to halt the fighting in Nicaragua and to obtain agreement on a broadly based transitional government there.

title: 500 Artists From All Over U.S. Trek to Rhinebeck. Crafts Fair
description: RHINEBECK, N.Y. FIRST they baked, then they shivered. But neither heat, rain, nor a cold wind that followed sudden deluge could chill the high spirits at Rhinebeck.

title: Paddleball Changing A Street
description: It was a special morning in the playground at West 46th Street, a morning when no drugs were sold and when the enormous radios were silent. The only sounds were the stinging beat of the paddleball as it ricocheted off the freshly painted wall back toward the four men who darted after it; the urgings of friends and neighbors, some of whom at other times would not come inside the fence, and the calls of a policeman, who, on this morning, was also a linesman.

title: Dance: New Troupe at Y
description: SAL PERNICE and Charles Goddertz are veteran Broadway musical theater gypsies who had the idea last November of starting a school for the training of musicalcomedy dancers. Last March they they formed the American Theater Dance Company with the aim of contributing to musicaltheater choreography and proving its viability. The company made its debut on Tuesday at the Kaufmann Concert Hall of the 92d Street Y.

title: AT HOME ABROAD No Balm In Riyadh
description: RIYADH, Saudi Arabia, June 20According to surveys, millions of Americans think there is no shortage of oil products  it is all a trick by the oil companies. As gasoline prices rise, people blame Washington. Independent truckers go on strike to demand lower prices for their diesel fuel.

title: Yisrael Yethayahu, 69, Speaker Of Israeli Parliament for 5 Years
description: TEL AVIV, June 20 (UPI)  Yisrael Yeshayahu, former speaker of the Israeli Parliament, died of cancer today. He was 69 years old.

title: Financial Consultant Indicted in Strangling Of a Diamond Dealer
description: Philip Drelich, a 28-year-old financial consultant who was charged last month with murdering his, ife, was indicted in Manhattan yesterday in the murder of a 71-year-old diamond dealer who disappeared with $500,000 worth of diamonds last March.

title: Book: Undercover Corruption Fighter
description: THERE are probably a dozen movie scripts, each more exciting than The French Connection, in this nonfiction story of a young detective, Robert Leuci, a bright light of a special narcotics unit who turned informer for the Knapp Commission, investigating corruption, eight or nine years ago.

title: Austrian Prices
description: VIENNA, June 20 (AP)  Austria's consumer price index in May was unchanged from April and up 3.1 percent from a year before, the central statistics office reported today. The index, which is based on 1976 prices equaling 100, stood at 112.3 in May.

title: U.S. Rejects Plea of Auto Makers To Relax Rule on Fuel Economy
description: WASHINGTON, June 20  The Department of Transportation today turned down requests of the automobile industry to relax its mandatory standards on fuel economy for Americanmade passenger cars of the early 1980's.

title: Soaring Youngsters Leave Handicaps Behind
description: Denise Cox rode like the wind yesterday, something a 12-year-old confined to a wheelchair is not often able to do.

title: 21 Are Indicted On Stolen Cards For Air Tickets
description: Twentyone men have been indicted by a special Federal grand jury in Brooklyn on charges that they were part of a ring that used lost and stblen airlinecredit cards to buy and resell more than 53.5 million worth of plane tickets since 1975.

title: How GasBuying Plans Work
description: Following is a summary of regulations governing the purchase and sale of gasoline in the New York City area and in New Jersey and Connecticut. The rules apply to diesel fuel in New Jersey and Connecticut, but not in New York.

title: Saving Amtrak From Its Friends
description: Finding gasoline along the interstates is so chancy these days that the passengertrain business is booming. Supporters of the deficitridden Amtrak are therefore hoping that Congress will now decide to reverse a welllaid plan of the Department of Transportation to eliminate about 40 percent of all passenger routes in October. Such a reversal would be a big mistake, even from the narrow perspective of the gasoline crisis.

title: 40 Die in Accident in Brazil
description: RECIFE, Brazil, June 20 (UPI)  The police said today that 40 people had been killed in an accident when a truck ploughed into a line of vehicles, including a bus that was stopped because of repair work on the highway.

title: Sound
description: THEY come from everywhere from, Germany- and Japan; England, Denmark, FranCe, Switzerland, and almost every one of the United States: What draws them'each June to the shores of Lake michisan  more than 60.000 of them  is the Consumer Electronics Show, a worldwide convocation of makers and sellers of sound equipment at MeCormick Place, Chicago's gigantic exhibition hall. There, in a frenzy of clangorous demonstrations, the audio Industry hopefully trots out its latest models for the benefit of distributors, dealers and tit press.

title: Breaking Point Gets Rail In Second Division of Cane
description: The good news for John Chapman yesterday was that he will be able to drive Breaking Point from the inside post at Yonkers Raceway on Saturday night in the $336,420 Cane Pace, New York's richest harness race.

title: An Oasis for Two Ballet Dancers
description: THEY sleep there. And that, pretty much, is it. Otherwise, his schedule usually keeps him away from 10:30 A.M to 11 P.M.  give or take a few mornings when he doesn't go to practice until noon. She flies out the door in the morning by 10:20. They agree that her hours are longer even than his, for she is still learning new ballets.

title: Beaths
description: RAPHAEL-Alfred Leon, D.D.S., Captain, U.S.N., retired. On Tuesday, June 19, 1979, in Silver Springs, MD. Husband of Ethel M. Raphael: Services at Fort Myer Chapel. Arlington, VA on Thursday, June 21 at 11am. Interment private. ExpresMons of sympathy in his memory may be made to the American Cancer Society.

title: TRUCKERS
description: WASHINGTON, Thursday, June 21 Independent truckers broadened their work stoppages and disruptions of freight shipments yesterday, and last night Government efforts to head them off failed.

title: Beaths
description: CU N N INGHAM-Charies C. of Brookline, Mass, on June 18, 1979, beloved father of Charles Jr., Priscilla, Thomas and James, brother of Esther Abbott, Mary Davis, and Joseph Cunningham. Also survived by five grandchildren. Memorial service Friday June 29 at 1 PM in Memorial Church, Harvard University, Cambridge, Mass. In lieu of flowers contributions to the Fogg Art Museum of Harvard University or Milton Academy, Milton, Mass. will be greatly appreciated.

title: Gallup Poll Ratings for President And Congress Sink to New Lows
description: The performance ratings given by the American public to both President Carter and Congress have slumped to new low points, according to the latest Gallup Poll.

title: Iran to Seize Some Industries
description: TEHERAN, Iran, June 20 (AP)  Irans revolutionary Government will seize inefficient industries and those abandoned by local or foreign owners who have left the country, the Budget and Planning Minister, All Akbar Moinfar, said today.

title: Mrs. King Is Hurt, Quits Match
description: EASTBOURNE, England, June 20 (UPI)  Billie Jean King dispelled fears about her fitness for Wimbledon only minutes after having hobbled out of her thirdround match against Australia's ?Kerry Reid in the $100,000 Eastbourne women's grass tennis tournament today.

title: GOING OUT Guide
description: ABOUT TIME Summer officially arrives today, heralded at Battery Park .by a twohour serenade starting at 7:30 P.M. as a group of 60 clarinetists gather in the park groves and proceed, playing, to the Castle Clinton seawall. The outdoor happening is produced by the New Wilderness Foundation.

title: Wayne Estate Put at $6.8 Million; Third Wife Is Left Out of the Will
description: SANTA ANA, Calif., June 20 (AP) John Wayne left an estate worth $6.85 million, but none of it will be going to his third wife, Pilar, from whom the actor separated in 1973, according to a will filed yesterday.

title: New Pine Tree Disease Is Reported in Missouri
description: WASHINGTON, June 20 (AP)  A new disease of pine trees has been found in nine Missouri counties in the first known outbreak- in the Western Hemisphere, the Agriculture Department has reported.

title: Dovle's Obsession Is I.O.R. Sail Victor

title: Associated Press
description: TALMADGE MAY HAVE TO TESTIFY ON ETHICS: The Senate ethics committee may consider ordering Senator Herman E. Talmadge to testify in his financial misconduct hearing, according to Adlal E. Stevenson 3d, center, the committee chairman. With the chairman before closed session yesterday were James Hamilton, right, one of Senator Talmadge's attorneys; Sherry Towel!, committee clerk, and Senator Harrison H. Schmitt.

title: Kudo Defends His Title; Runs Victory Streak to 23
description: YOKAICHI, Japan, June 20 (UPI) Masashi Kudo, the World Boxing Association junior middleweight champion, stopped Manuel Gonzalez in the 12th round of their title match today when the challenger's handlers threw in the towel as the Argentine fighter lay bleeding on the floor.

title: Blue Cross Adds 60 Days of Care For Rehabilitation of Alcoholics
description: Blue Cross and Blue Shield of Greater New York announced that it would increase benefits for treatment of alcoholism, adding a maximum of 60 days of rehabilitative care to the five days of detoxification in a hospital or clinic that it now offers.

title: High Above Las Vegas, a Christian Nightclub!
description: The following remarks are excerpted from an interview with the Rev. Bill Sharp of Las Vegas contained in the forthcoming book Great American Dreams by Robert G. Kaiser and Jon Lowell.
